column2: SAP WMS (Warehouse Management System) is a software solution designed to manage and optimize warehouse operations within organizations. As a SAP WMS consultant or professional, your role involves configuring, implementing, and supporting SAP WMS to meet the specific needs of your clients or organization. Here's an overview of your responsibilities and tasks:Solution Design and Configuration: You would work closely with clients to understand their warehouse operations, requirements, and goals. Based on this analysis, you would design the SAP WMS solution architecture and configure the system to support warehouse processes such as inbound and outbound logistics, inventory management, storage bin management, picking, packing, and shipping.Master Data Setup: You would set up master data within SAP WMS, including material master data, storage bin configurations, warehouse structures, and handling unit profiles. This involves defining warehouse layout, storage types, storage sections, storage bins, and assigning appropriate attributes to each storage bin based on material characteristics and storage requirements.Integration: SAP WMS typically integrates with other SAP modules such as SAP ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning), SAP EWM (Extended Warehouse Management), and SAP SCM (Supply Chain Management), as well as with external systems such as barcode scanners, RFID (Radio Frequency Identification) systems, and transportation management systems. You would be responsible for ensuring seamless integration between SAP WMS and these systems to enable data exchange and process automation.Custom Development: While SAP WMS provides standard functionality for warehouse management processes, you may need to develop custom enhancements or interfaces to address unique business requirements. This could involve writing ABAP code, developing custom reports, or configuring custom workflows within the SAP WMS solution.User Training and Support: You would provide training and support to warehouse personnel on how to use SAP WMS effectively to perform their daily tasks. This may involve conducting training sessions, creating user documentation, and providing ongoing support to address user questions and issues.Testing and Validation: You would conduct testing and validation of the SAP WMS solution to ensure that it meets the specified requirements and functions correctly in different scenarios. This may involve unit testing, integration testing, user acceptance testing, and regression testing to identify and resolve any issues before the system goes live.Performance Optimization: You would optimize the performance of SAP WMS to ensure efficient warehouse operations and timely processing of transactions. This may involve tuning system configurations, optimizing database performance, and identifying and resolving performance bottlenecks.Continuous Improvement: After the initial implementation, you would continue to optimize and enhance the SAP WMS solution based on feedback, changing business requirements, and emerging best practices. This may involve conducting regular performance reviews, implementing system upgrades, and exploring opportunities for automation and process improvement.
column11: Any Graduate, Any Postgraduate
column13: SAP WMS, warehouse management system, sap scm, shipping, warehouse operations, supply chain management, transport management, outbound logistics, inventory management, transportation

column2: We are seeking great product managers to join our team. This role will be responsible for conceptualizing, defining, launching, and managing 314e s healthcare product offerings for its enterprise customers.   As a product manager, you will help define and build new products and features that make it easier for medical professionals to adopt technology in their day-to-day lives. Product managers at 314e collaborate closely with internal engineering as well as customer-focused teams and existing/potential customers to set strategies for, define, design, and directly manage all aspects of the customer experience.   A successful candidate will be customer-obsessed, highly analytical, have experience working on B2B enterprise products, and be adept at building high-quality products with a focus towards shipping meaningful software. The ideal candidate will be able to focus, both on the big picture for the future as well as the immediate priorities of the here-and-now. The candidate should be able to work iteratively experimentally, building support for their vision, while taking input from other contributors.  Basic Qualifications    5+ years of experience in software product management     Bachelor s degree in an engineering discipline     Ability to contribute to product strategy and roadmap     Prior startup experience     Ability to meaningfully contribute to engineering discussions around technology decisions     Experience leading cross-functional teams     Enjoys living in a complex, ambiguous, and fast-paced environment using agile process and experimentation   Preferred Qualifications    Lived the product life. You ve shipped products that have made a positive impact on business customer metrics. You have demonstrated the ability to build consensus, and securing buy-in amongst conflicting priorities of different team members. You have proven ability to make smart decisions when encountered with features versus time-to-market trade-offs.     Analytical and data-focused. You have demonstrated the use of data and metrics to support your assumptions and assertions of business parameters. You benefit from your strong analytical skills and ability to dive deep into the subject matter and develop a comprehensive understanding of your customers and their needs to create effective solutions. You have experience in gathering data (primary or secondary) and in making high impact decisions even in the absence of a lot of facts and figures to support your decisions.     Strong technical understanding. You can understand, discuss, and challenge software design concepts, develop trade-offs, and identify potential business opportunities with technical team members.     Excellent communication skills. You are equally comfortable taking the center stage and getting your message across to a board-room full of CXOs, negotiating timelines in an all-hands tech-team meeting, or writing a detailed six-page narrative on your products that you can defend with the customer s business, technology finance teams. You can condense six pages to one page without losing the meaning, and vice-versa.     Strong collaboration skills. You have demonstrated the ability to work across seniority levels, functions, and roles, to influence senior leadership. You quickly earn the trust of the people you work with. People enjoy and have fun working with you.     Empathy. You can put yourself in the shoes of the customers and can translate their real needs into crisp, actionable, detailed product requirements. You can develop innovative product solutions that are grounded in a deep understanding of customer needs.     Bias for action. Your default setting is to take action, and not wait for things to happen. You love to learn about new ideas and ways to improve the customer experience. You obsess about what matters most to customers and can align product offerings to deliver benefits to customers quickly.

column2: The Senior Developer, will work across the stack and be responsible for building scalable applications and systems that get invoked through the entire customer journey. He/She will work closely with the Technical Project Manager, System Architect and QA to build and ship key features through, modular, and high-performing backend development and testing.    JOB QUALIFICATIONS   A. EDUCATION: Bachelor s/ Master s in Computer Science, Information Technology, or an engineering discipline with a heavy emphasis on computer science is required.    EXPERIENCE:   - Overall experience of 10+ years with 3-5 years of software development experience inJavaScript   - Experience with full stack backend development from raw data ingest, to database management, to user interface design and implementation     DISCIPLINE SPECIFIC EXPERIENCE:   - Comprehensive knowledge of SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle)   - Experience in Python, JavaScript, knowledge of C++   - Experience will HTML, CSS, Typescript, or similar a plus   - Experience in Relational Database Management Systems (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, or Microsoft SQL Server; optimization of SQL queries for performance   - Proficiency in API Design and Management Designing and managing RESTful APIs   - Good knowledge of using issue tracking tools (e.g., JIRA), code collaboration tools (e.g., Git) and team collaboration tools (e.g., Confluence/Wiki).   - Experience with microservices, Linux based development experience is preferable.   - Implementation knowhow of role-based access control (RBAC) and permissions     GENERAL:   - Excellent problem solving, analytical, debugging skills   - Very good understanding of container technologies & development for cloud scenarios   - Broad, enterprise-class technical knowledge in the areas of application development, operations, information security, and cloud architecture   - Familiarity with front-end to collaborate effectively with front-end developers   - Experience in writing and executing unit tests for individual functions and modules; Using testing frameworks such as JUnit (for Java) or pytest (for Python)   - Individual contributor through hand s on approach to work     JOB FUNCTIONS   A. SPECIFIC:   - Own back-end development and integration of modules of proposed applications; Participate in the development lifecycle on all applicable fronts and complexities   - Solve developmental challenges in different areas such as microservices architecture, API integration, browser application, testing, product development etc.   - Contribute to technical discussions and requirement analysis with internal partners to drive alignment with development requirements   - Collaborate with the System architect to design and implement effective server-side architecture, considering scalability and maintainability   - Optimize backend code for needs of priority use cases and broader business, minimize downtime, and routinely inspect code for errors   - Set up monitoring tools for tracking database performance; ensure regular database maintenance tasks such as index rebuilding and statistics updates   - Build knowledge on different types of indexes; understand and implement indexes to enhance query performance.   - Implement CI/CD pipelines for automated testing and deployment; ensure test coverage and code quality are in line with established guidelines   - Support administration, deployment and optimization of services in production   - Troubleshoot and resolve reported technical issues to ensure application reliability; Test error handling mechanisms and ensure graceful degradation under unexpected conditions   - Help in structuring server-side information for utilization by frontend and/or UI/UX team; design/optimize database schemas for relational and non-relational databases   - Continuously suggest and implement improvements to make our development processes more efficient and to keep technology stack up to date   - Ensure compliance with industry standards and best practices for data security, privacy, and regulatory requirements; compatibility with current systems & future integration.   - Ensure all deployments exhibit high levels of performance, security, scalability, maintainability, and appropriate reusability and reliability; collaborate with QA team to ensure a well-tested, high-quality, end product is delivered   - Write documentation for ensuring that documentation is updated with each code release; identify and mitigate potential security vulnerabilities in the codebase.     GENERAL:   - Gain a solid understanding of the scientific application/use-case being addressed with the product.   - Work closely with cross-functional teams, including scientists, engineers, and IT professionals, to understand requirements and align solution development with organizational goals.   - Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement within the product management team   - Commitment to high ethical standards and focus on delivering value for the organization and end-users.   - Commitment to actively participating in and improving organizational workflows and processes

column2: Required Qualification:   Diploma or B.E. Mechanical / Industrial / Production Engg.   Experience  : 2 to 3 yrs exp in Purchase, Vendor development and Production planning activities.    Keys Duties:   1) Forecast levels of demand for services and products to meet the business needs and keeping a constant check on stock levels.  2) Conduct research to ascertain the best products and suppliers in terms of best value, delivery schedules and quality.  3) Liaise between suppliers, manufacturers, relevant internal departments and customers.  4) Identify potential suppliers, visit existing suppliers, build and maintain good relationships with them.  5) Negotiate and agree contracts and monitor their progress, check the quality of service provided.  6) Maintain contract files and refer it as reference for the future.  7) Forecast price trends and their impact on future activities.  8) Deliver presentations about market analysis and possible growth.  9) Developing organization s purchase strategy.  10) Produce reports and statistics using computer software.  11) Ensure suppliers are aware of business objectives.  12) Attend meetings and trade conferences.  13) Maintain records of goods ordered and received.  14) Prepare and process requisitions, purchase orders for supplies and equipment.  15) Review purchase order claims and contracts for conformance to company policy.    16) Select and / or approve new vendor / sub-contractor including calibration agencies, laboratory, testing, inspection, consultancy and transport services based on   A) ISO 9000 certification  B) Customer approval or recommendations.  C) Vendor evaluation  D) Authorized dealers   17) Monitoring of Vendors performance  18) Plan the material and process of work order issued, with priorities in consultation with marketing in charge and as per production and dispatch plan.  19) Responsible for vendor visit and audits.  20) Ensure manufacturing of products based on production schedule, assign personnel, supervise staff, observes control points and equipment s, organize and monitor work flow.  21) Monitor and control the production activity as per Production plan.  22) Ensure Cleanliness of Shop Floor and equipment s etc.  23) Implements cost reduction, develops reporting procedures, co-ordinates between departments.  24) Maintains quality services by enforcing organization standards.  25) Maintains and repairs equipment s, evaluate new equipment s and techniques  26) Provides manufacturing information by compiling, initiating, sorting, analyzing production performance records and data answering questions and responding to results.  27) Create and revise systems and procedures by analyzing practices records keeping systems forms of control and budgetary and personnel requirements, implementing changes  28) Maintain safe and clean work environment by educating and directing personnel on the use of all control points equipment s and resources.  29) Resolve personnel problems by analyzing data investigating issues, identifying solutions, recommendation action.  30) Attends educational workshops, review professional publications etc. for knowledge up gradation.  31) Contribute to terms efforts by accomplishments related results as needed.  32) Achieve departmental goal. column2: We are looking for an Android Developer for our Digital Marketing, Web Services IT Agency clients based in the USA and Canada.    You will be responsible for the development and maintenance of applications aimed at a vast number of diverse Android devices.    Your primary focus will be the development of Android applications and their integration with back-end services.    You will be working alongside other engineers and developers working on different layers of the infrastructure.    Therefore, commitment to collaborative problem-solving, sophisticated design, and creating quality products is essential.     Job Responsibilities:          Design and develop advanced applications for the Android platform.    Translate designs and wireframes into high-quality code.    Design, build, and maintain high-performance, reusable, and reliable Java code.    Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the application.    Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs and improve application performance.    Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization.    Unit-testing code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability.    Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.    Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency.    Work with outside data sources and APIs.     Experience Skills:        Strong knowledge of Android SDK, different versions of Android, and how to deal with different screen sizes.    Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect Android applications to back-end services.    Strong knowledge of Android UI design principles, patterns, and best practices.    Experience with offline storage, threading, and performance tuning.    Ability to design applications around natural user interfaces, such as touch .    Familiarity with the use of additional sensors, such as gyroscopes and accelerometers.    Knowledge of the open-source Android ecosystem and the libraries available.    Familiarity with cloud message APIs and push notifications.    A knack for benchmarking and optimization.    Understanding of Google s Android design principles and interface guidelines.    Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git.    Familiarity with continuous integration.

column2: An accountant cum cashier is a financial professional who handles both accounting and cash management duties for an organization.   Accounting: The accountant cum cashier is responsible for maintaining the financial records of the organization, including recording financial transactions, preparing financial statements, and reconciling bank accounts.   Cash Management: The accountant cum cashier is responsible for managing the cash flow of the organization, including monitoring cash balances, preparing cash forecasts, and reconciling cash receipts.   Accounts Payable: The accountant cum cashier is responsible for managing the organization's accounts payable, including processing invoices, issuing payments, and maintaining vendor records

column2: Daily Accounting:     Maintain accurate and up-to-date accounting records.   Record financial transactions, including sales, expenses, and other financial activities.   Ensure all financial transactions are correctly classified and posted to the appropriate accounts.      Invoicing:     Generate and send invoices to clients promptly and accurately.   Verify invoices for completeness and accuracy before issuance.   Monitor and follow up on outstanding invoices and ensure timely payments.   Bank Reconciliation:   Reconcile bank statements with internal financial records.   Investigate and resolve discrepancies or variances in a timely manner.   Maintain a clear and organized record of all banking transactions.   GST and TDS Compliance:   Prepare and file monthly, quarterly, and annual GST returns.   Ensure accurate calculation and deduction of TDS from various payments.   File TDS returns within the prescribed deadlines.   Financial Reporting:   Prepare financial statements, including profit and loss statements and balance sheets.   Provide regular financial reports to management for decision-making.   Assist in budgeting and forecasting activities.   Compliance and Documentation:   Stay updated on changes in tax laws and regulations.   Maintain organized and well-documented financial records for audit and compliance purposes.   Assist in annual audits and liaise with auditors as necessary.      Qualifications:     Bachelors degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.   8 to 10 years in the field of accounting / should be comfortable with Tally ERP

column2: Join our IT GTM Systems team to lead our Salesforce platform initiatives, driving innovation and excellence across Sales, Marketing, Services, Customer Success, and Partner functions. We seek a technically adept individual with a passion for elevating platform performance, usability, and security. Your deep expertise in Salesforce development, coupled with a keen eye for process optimization, will propel our IT infrastructure forward.     In this role you will     Own and manage the Salesforce platform and health.   Design and build scalable technical solutions across the Salesforce platform and related applications, using your deep knowledge of Salesforce, Force.com, Apex Code, Visualforce, Lightning Components, Lightning Web Components, SOQL, triggers and other programming logic.   Take overall accountability for the health of the Salesforce org and platform, with an eye toward usability, performance, scalability, reusability of code, stability, security, smooth deployments, and information availability.   Drive admin/developer productivity and collaboration throughout the development process, facilitating automated testing and continuous integration (eg, scratch orgs).   Define, setup, and maintain the sandbox landscape and pipelines and work closely with DevOps and QA to ensure best practices and defect-free deployments across environments.   Develop a repeatable playbook for the sandbox refresh cycle and management.   Define Cornerstone s Salesforce coding standards and best practices; lead and guide developers WW and ensure that they follow coding standards and development and documentation guidelines.   Ensure technical documentation is maintained and continuously updated, as part of the SDLC process.   Collaborate with, mentor, and guide the development teams on delivering quality code and test classes.   Participate in key phases of the Salesforce development lifecycle, including solution design, configuration, code development, testing, and deployment.   Work closely with all IT stakeholders, ensure Salesforce platform health, security, controls, and compliance.   Build functionality to improve performance, security, scalability, and reliability of company s Salesforce platform.   Proactively seek opportunities for process improvement: identify and resolve process bottlenecks, data issues, and inconsistencies to help improve operational efficiencies.   Take ownership of escalated or complex issues and follow through to resolution.     you've got what it takes if you have      8-10 years development experience with at least 3-4 years in a technical lead role. Strong technical expertise with business awareness.   Experience working across Lead-to-Order processes and functions across the enterprise: Marketing, Sales, Deal Desk, Order Mgmt., Support, Customer Success, Partner/Alliances, SaaS Product Engineering, and Professional Services.   Experience in declarative and programmatic solutioning: core configuration, flows, writing Apex code and triggers, VF pages & Lightning Web components, SOQL, SOSL, etc   Knowledge in developing and deploying solutions using Salesforce Lightning (Lightning Design System/ Lightning App Builder/Lightning Web components).   Broad and deep knowledge and experience with the Salesforce product suite: Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, CPQ, Experience Cloud; Einstein;   Experience leading technical requirements gathering and building solutions from those requirements; working at-scale by reusing components and code to push apps out fast.   Experience with development tools, including Force.com IDE or Illuminated Cloud, Ant migration tool, GitHub, and others.   Experience with agile methodologies, including scrum, and continuous integration environments (Copado etc) and waterfall.   Expert level understanding of environment management, release management, code versioning best practices, and deployment methodologies.   Passion for excellence   Ability to work seamlessly as part of a multi-site, multicultural, development and testing team, internal and external resources.
column11: Any Graduate, Any Postgraduate
column13: Product engineering, Data management, Performance management, Coding, Agile, Scrum, Release management, SDLC, Salesforce, Technical documentation

column2: Receive all updates via . Just Click the Like Button Below...  Job Description  Designation : -  Chief Data Officer ( CDO ) Location : -  Bangalore  Reporting to : -  COO  Client Details :  Our world is inherently geographic. Understanding context ,  the impact & the unique situation a customer has on a business ,  is critical to business success. Our client provides deep insights into the behaviour of customers in micro markets.  Our client is an expert in location and predictive analytics space with the goal being predicting human behavior to influence decision making. Currently we are in the process of developing our analytics platform using some of the latest and cutting edge technologies ,  which will handle millions of records from hundreds of data sources.  With use Artificial Intelligence ,  Neural Networks and Behavioural Psychology ,  our client helps companies drive business transformation by helping them combine alternate ,  external and traditional data to gain a competitive advantage. Founded in 2014 ,  our client is one of the top 10 new Startups in the data analytics segment in India and growing.  With over 100 use cases and customers in BFSI ,  Retail  ,  Healthcare and other sectors ,  our client with offices in 3 locations currently is expanding. The quality of people within this company is an interesting blend of team members from MIT ,  IITs and IIMS across all functions.  Currently our client is looking for interesting minds to build an organisation which offers immense value to all the stake holders. Job Description :  The CDO shall bear the responsibility for the firm s enterprise wide data and information strategy ,  governance ,  control ,  policy development ,  and effective exploitation.  The CDO s role will combine accountability and responsibility for information protection and privacy ,  information governance ,  data quality and data life cycle management ,  along with the exploitation of data assets to create business value.  The CDO shall be in charge of overseeing the larger Data and Analytics department. This is inclusive of the Data Analytics and Data Science departments. He shall oversee the development of new data analytics capabilities across the business and manage on - going comprehensive data analytics.  The Chief Data Officer shall be responsible for driving the Data and Analytics Department vision ,  strategy ,  and execution.  The Chief Data Officer strives to ensure that the department is functioning to enable sustainable business growth and profitability ,  internal efficiencies through improved data structures ,  constant data cleanliness and insight ,  efficient data governance and process.  The role of the Chief Data Officer is responsible for the development of the Data and Analytics department s overall strategy and owning the business s data management roadmap as well as securing the funding necessary to see through the department s vision.  The Chief Data Officer ensures that the various Data and Analytics departments have their goals aligned with the business s mission ,  strategy ,  and objectives.  The role of the Chief Data Officer is also a part of the executive leadership committee within the business and together with other executives ,  the Chief Data Officer participates in business - wide decision - making and strategy formulation  Objectives and Responsibilities : -   Leadership Role : -   CDO Shall be in charge of overseeing the larger data and analytics department . The department shall include both data analytics and data science Departments .  Oversee Strategic data priorities of the department and identifies new business opportunities  Shall regulate how the business captures  ,  maintains and presents and information at a top level in order to measure performance  The Chief Data Officer provides expertise and consults on all major datarelated initiatives inclusive of personnel recruiting ,  development ,  and retention within the business.  Chief Data Officer also plays a mentorship role to key personnel within the Data and Analytics department ,  assisting in the execution of their function upon request ,  and encouraging the constant growth in their professional skills in order for them to take up his functions in the future.  Strategic Role :  -   The Chief Data Officer plays a leading strategic role where he defines and oversees how the business captures ,  maintains ,  and applies data and information in order to support of key business processes.  He establishes the strategic direction for building the business s data management program and optimizing how the business uses data both internally and externally.  In this capacity ,  the Chief Data Officer acts as a thought leader defining the business s data strategy and data roadmap  The Chief Data Officer plays an analytical role where he defines and drives all analytics and business intelligence initiatives in the Data and Analytics department.  The Chief Data Officer defines appropriate analytical models necessary to support use cases such as customer segmentation ,  among others and leverages the power of predictive insights and analytics.  In this capacity ,  the Chief Data Officer is tasked with providing the data analytics infrastructure that support and achieves operational business goals and targets.  Colloboration :  The Chief Data Officer plays a highly collaborative role and in this position ,  he shall oversee cross - functional data governance while simultaneously ensuring adoption and adherence to data quality and process governance in the relevant collaborating departments.  The Chief Data Officer partners closely with Tech leadership responsible for data analytics ,  custodianship ,  and infrastructure ensuring alignment with the Data and Analytics department avoiding conflicting activities ,  and availing the most efficient data analytics insights across the business Knowledge and Opportunity:  The Chief Data Officer acts as an authority within the Data and Analytics department ,  promoting the use of industry leading trends and new data management technologies. He is also responsible for finding data analytic opportunities for the business and ensuring data and information compliance with the business policy and external legal requirements. Skill Required  Skills and Qualification: -   Minimum Education Qualification : -   PhD or Masters in data Science . Statistics  ,  Analytics or any other related field.  Preferred age : -  Below 40  -  12 to 15 + Years of working experience in Data Analytics or Data Science field with minimum 5 years in leadership position .  -   Should be highly knowledgeable in front - to - back data lifecycle and be highly proficient in wide array of data tools and technologies such Hadoop ,  Teradata ,  SQL ,  Redshift ,  PostgreSQL ,  Vertica as well as scripting languages such as Python and R  -   Should have worked across industries like BFSI  ,  Retail  ,  Healthcare preferable and have dealt with data of various nature .  Should possess excellent communication skills which shall help in attaining clarity both internally and externally .  -   Should have trackable record of building teams and scaling the business in terms of Data sourcing  ,  management and deployment for various solutions  Education Required  PhD or Masters in data Science . Statistics  ,  Analytics or any other related field.  Preferred age : -  Below 40  -  12 to 15 + Years of working experience in Data Analytics or Data Science field with minimum 5 years in leadership position

column2: Sea and Beyond is looking for Senior Demurrage Analyst to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey    The Senior Demurrage Analyst is responsible for overseeing and optimizing demurrage-related activities within the shipping and logistics operations    This includes monitoring vessel movements, analyzing demurrage charges, negotiating with carriers, and implementing strategies to reduce demurrage costs    The role requires a strong understanding of shipping logistics, contractual agreements, and industry regulations     Key Responsibilities:     Demurrage Monitoring:Monitor vessel schedules and cargo movements to identify potential demurrage situations    Analyze demurrage data and trends to proactively address and mitigate issues    Contractual Review:Review and analyze shipping contracts to understand demurrage terms and conditions    Ensure compliance with contractual agreements and identify opportunities for improvement    Negotiation and Communication:Engage in negotiations with carriers, suppliers, and internal stakeholders to resolve demurrage-related issues    Communicate effectively with relevant parties to convey demurrage policies, guidelines, and expectations    Data Analysis and Reporting:Utilize data analysis tools to generate reports on demurrage-related costs and trends    Provide regular reports and insights to management, highlighting areas for improvement    Process Improvement:Identify inefficiencies in demurrage processes and propose improvements to streamline operations    Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement best practices    Regulatory Compliance:Stay informed about industry regulations and compliance requirements related to demurrage    Ensure that demurrage practices align with legal and regulatory standards    Training and Development:Provide training to junior analysts and other team members on demurrage processes and best practices    Stay updated on industry developments and share knowledge within the organization    Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, or a related field    Several years of experience in demurrage analysis or a similar role within the shipping industry    In-depth knowledge of shipping contracts, logistics, and demurrage regulations    Strong analytical and negotiation skills    Excellent communication and interpersonal skills    Proficiency in data analysis tools and Microsoft Office suite
column11: Any Graduate, Any Postgraduate
column13: Data analysis, Supply chain management, Interpersonal skills, Senior Analyst, Process improvement, Analytical, Regulatory compliance, Training and Development, MS Office, Logistics

column2: A Technical Superintendent is a key role in the maritime industry, specifically within the shipping or maritime operations sector    They are responsible for overseeing the technical aspects of vessel operations and ensuring that ships are maintained and operated in compliance with industry regulations and standards    Here are the primary responsibilities of a Technical Superintendent:Vessel Maintenance and Repairs: Technical Superintendents are responsible for coordinating and supervising the maintenance, repair, and dry-docking activities of vessels under their management    They develop maintenance plans, monitor the condition of machinery and equipment, and schedule necessary repairs to ensure the safe and efficient operation of the vessels    Compliance with Regulations: They ensure that vessels comply with various international and national regulations, classification society requirements, and industry standards    They keep abreast of regulatory changes, implement necessary modifications or upgrades, and oversee inspections and audits to maintain compliance    Budgeting and Cost Control: Technical Superintendents manage the budget for vessel maintenance and repair activities    They prepare cost estimates, analyze expenses, and control costs to ensure efficient allocation of resources    They may also liaise with suppliers and negotiate contracts to obtain competitive pricing for services and spare parts    Spare Parts and Inventory Management: They oversee the procurement, storage, and management of spare parts, consumables, and supplies required for vessel operations    They maintain inventory levels, coordinate with suppliers, and ensure timely availability of necessary items to minimize downtime    Crew Training and Development: Technical Superintendents provide guidance and support to vessel crews regarding technical operations, maintenance procedures, and safety protocols    They may organize training programs or workshops to enhance the skills and knowledge of the onboard technical staff    Safety and Environmental Compliance: They enforce safety procedures and ensure that vessels comply with environmental regulations, including pollution prevention measures    They monitor the implementation of safety management systems and conduct risk assessments to mitigate potential hazards    Performance Monitoring: Technical Superintendents analyze vessel performance data, such as fuel consumption, machinery efficiency, and voyage analysis    They identify areas for improvement and implement measures to optimize vessel performance, reduce fuel consumption, and enhance operational efficiency    Emergency Response and Crisis Management: They contribute to emergency response planning and crisis management procedures    They work closely with vessel crews, onboard officers, and shore-based teams to develop contingency plans, conduct drills, and respond effectively to emergency situations    Technical Documentation and Reporting: They maintain accurate records and documentation related to vessel operations, maintenance activities, inspections, and repairs    They prepare technical reports, including condition assessment reports, repair status reports, and maintenance history reports for internal and external stakeholders    Technical Support and Troubleshooting: Technical Superintendents provide technical support and guidance to onboard personnel and shore-based teams    They assist in troubleshooting technical issues, identify root causes of problems, and recommend appropriate solutions or repairs
column11: Any Graduate, Any Postgraduate
column13: Procurement, Technical Superintendent, Crisis management, Spare parts, Maritime, Troubleshooting, Operations, Technical support, Technical documentation

column2: A logistic coordinator plays a crucial role in managing and coordinating the logistics operations of a company or organization    They are responsible for ensuring the smooth flow of goods, services, or information from the point of origin to the final destination    The specific job duties and responsibilities may vary depending on the industry and organization, but here are some common tasks associated with the role of a logistic coordinator:Planning and Scheduling: Logistic coordinators are responsible for planning and scheduling the transportation of goods or services    This includes determining the most efficient routes, modes of transportation, and delivery schedules to meet customer requirements and minimize costs    Coordination: They coordinate with various stakeholders, such as suppliers, vendors, shipping companies, and internal departments, to ensure timely delivery of goods    This involves monitoring shipments, tracking inventory levels, and resolving any issues or delays that may arise during transportation    Documentation: Logistic coordinators prepare and maintain documentation related to logistics activities    They ensure that all necessary permits, licenses, customs documentation, and shipping records are accurately completed and maintained in compliance with applicable regulations    Inventory Management: They monitor inventory levels, conduct regular stock checks, and coordinate with warehouse personnel to ensure adequate stock availability    Logistic coordinators also analyze inventory data and make recommendations for optimizing inventory levels and minimizing storage costs    Cost Optimization: They work to optimize logistics costs by analyzing transportation rates, negotiating contracts with suppliers and carriers, and identifying cost-saving opportunities    Logistic coordinators may also be involved in budgeting and financial analysis related to logistics operations
column11: Any Graduate, Any Postgraduate
column13: Logistic Coordinator, Financial analysis, Inventory management, Scheduling, Logistics operations, Budgeting, Cost optimization, Monitoring, Inventory, Logistics

column2: Sea and Beyond is looking for Asst. Manager (Purchase) to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey"   The Assistant Manager (Purchase) is responsible for supporting the procurement function by efficiently managing the purchase process, negotiating with suppliers, and ensuring timely delivery of goods and services   This role requires a strong understanding of procurement processes, supplier management, and the ability to collaborate with various departments to meet organizational goals   Key Responsibilities:Procurement Planning:Collaborate with department heads to understand their procurement needs   Develop and implement procurement plans in line with organizational objectives and budget constraints   Supplier Identification and Evaluation:Identify potential suppliers and conduct thorough evaluations to assess their capabilities, reliability, and financial stability   Maintain a database of approved suppliers and update it regularly   Negotiation and Contract Management:Negotiate terms and conditions with suppliers to secure advantageous agreements   Draft and review contracts, ensuring compliance with legal and organizational standards   Order Processing and Tracking:Process purchase orders accurately and in a timely manner   Monitor and track orders to ensure on-time delivery and resolve any issues that may arise   Cost Management:Implement cost-effective measures without compromising quality   Regularly review supplier agreements to identify cost-saving opportunities   Relationship Management:Cultivate strong relationships with suppliers to enhance collaboration and ensure a stable supply chain   Address and resolve any supplier-related issues promptly   Compliance:Ensure procurement activities comply with relevant laws, regulations, and company policies   Keep abreast of changes in procurement regulations and update processes accordingly   Market Research:Stay informed about market trends, new products, and industry best practices   Utilize market intelligence to make informed purchasing decisions   Team Collaboration:Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including finance, operations, and quality assurance, to ensure a coordinated approach to procurement   Reporting:Prepare and present regular reports on procurement activities, including cost savings, supplier performance, and other key metrics   Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Business, Supply Chain Management, or a related field   Proven experience in procurement or a related role   Strong negotiation and communication skills   Familiarity with procurement software and tools   Knowledge of relevant laws and regulations    ?

column2: Sea and Beyond is looking for Master mariner to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.A Master Mariner, often referred to as a Captain, is a highly experienced and qualified professional responsible for the safe and efficient operation of a ship at sea. This role involves a combination of navigational and managerial duties. Here is a comprehensive job description for a Master Mariner:   Navigation and Seamanship:Plan and execute safe and efficient navigation of the vessel, considering weather conditions, traffic, and any other potential hazards.Ensure compliance with international and local maritime regulations.Supervise and train deck officers and crew in navigation procedures and safety protocols.Conduct regular navigational assessments and drills.   Safety and Emergency Response:Implement and enforce safety policies and procedures to ensure the well-being of the crew, passengers, and the vessel.Coordinate and lead emergency response drills and exercises.Take immediate and effective action in emergency situations to ensure the safety of the vessel and its occupants.   Crew Management:Supervise and manage the ship's crew, including hiring, training, and evaluating performance.Foster a positive working environment and maintain effective communication among the crew.Ensure compliance with labor and employment regulations.   Operational Management:Oversee the loading and unloading of cargo, ensuring proper stowage and securing.Manage the ship's budget, including expenditures on fuel, provisions, and maintenance.Keep accurate records of the ship's activities, including cargo operations, maintenance, and crew movements.   Communication and Reporting:Maintain regular communication with shore-based authorities, such as port authorities and shipping companies.Prepare and submit reports as required by regulatory bodies and the ship's owners.   Navigation Equipment and Technology:Ensure that the ship's navigation and communication equipment is properly maintained and in good working order.Stay updated on advancements in navigation technology and implement relevant improvements on board.   Environmental Responsibility:Adhere to environmental regulations and implement practices to minimize the ship's impact on the environment.Manage waste disposal in accordance with international standards.   Legal and Regulatory Compliance:Stay informed about and ensure compliance with international maritime laws, regulations, and conventions.Maintain required certifications and licenses.   Crisis Management:Develop and implement crisis management plans to address potential risks and emergencies.Collaborate with relevant authorities in case of incidents, accidents, or investigations.   Professional Development:Pursue continuous professional development and training to stay abreast of industry trends and advancements.
column11: Any Graduate, Any Postgraduate
column13: Supervisor, Training, Crisis management, Operations management, cargo operations, Maritime, Regulatory compliance, Manager Technology, Management, Captain

column2: Required Qualification:   Graduate in Commerce/ Masters in Commerce / Accounting     Required Experience:   Transformation experience: At least 6 months to 1 year of process automation / optimization / standardization experience.    Transformation experience will be an added advantage    Operational experience: At least 5-8 years of operational delivery experience in R2A processes     Roles and Responsibilities:   Capgemini Clients are increasingly looking for valued partnerships and expertise to help them develop innovative solutions to complex transformation problems.    Finance Transformation Team (FTT) is a transformation consulting discipline within Business Services that offers process diagnosis and transformation support to Capgemini BPO Clients through understanding specific needs of Customers representing various business sectors, providing the Clients with expertise and resources to transform their support functions    Finance and Accounting (FA): Procure-to-Pay (P2P), Order-to-Cash (O2C) and Record-to-Report (R2R) processes Supply Chain Human Resources (HR): Hire-to-Retire (H2R) process New BPO products development and new BPO sales opportunities are also supported.    You will help our Clients to redefine and to optimize their back office processes, to develop visions, to improve operations and systems and to drive performance in FA, Supply Chain and HR.    The current role is aimed to enhance the business transformation skill set around the R2A business function and would thereby involve the following key responsibilities:Project Delivery: Effectively support transformation projects.    This may include (but will not be limited to) project planning, support client workshops as SME, reporting writing and support facilitator to playback to the client, building client relationship.    Business Development: Assisting responses to RFI, RFQ, and RFP. Representing FTT in client presentations and proposal orals.    Practice Development: Assist transformation product or service development / refinement, in developing subject matter white papers, concept papers, etc    The role holder must comply with all the Quality Management System (QMS), Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) and Information Security Management System (ISMS) requirements and guidelines of the organization     Required Skills:   Should have good understanding about R2A cycle. Should have good experience in General Accounting (R2A) (Intercompany, Fixed Asset accounting, Treasury accounting, Month end closing, Reconciliations, Reporting)    Transformation experience: At least 6 months to 1 year of process automation / optimization / standardization experience.    Transformation experience will be an added advantage.     Operational experience:   At least 5-8 years of operational delivery experience in R2A processes.    Excellent analytical and Technical skills    Good interpersonal skills.    It is important that the candidate displays collaboration within / across teams.    Good written and oral communication skills along with advanced MS Outlook knowledge, preferably client facing role.    A focus on results and a flexible cando approach.    Strong executive presence for effective communication with senior client stakeholder.    Prior experience of engaging with client will be good to have.    Ability to deliver effectively in high pressure unstructured project environment.    Strong organizational skills required; including good time management    Willingness to learn, work in accordance to project based time zones, grows and stretches into new roles and different industries.
column11: Any Graduate, B.Com in Commerce, M.Com in Commerce, MBA/PGDM in Marketing

To oversee shipping and receiving processes, inspect shipments, and resolve any issues.     Organizes and maintains the warehouse layout, implements efficient processes, and ensures compliance with safety regulations.      Generating reports, analyzing data, and collaborating with other departments are also part of their role.     Requirements:     The ideal candidate should have proven experience in warehouse management or a similar role.     Strong knowledge of inventory management and warehouse best practices is required.     Proficiency in warehouse management systems and relevant software is desired.

column2: Sea and Beyond is looking for 2nd / 3rd Engineer to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.    Technical Responsibilities:     a. Engine Room Operations: Oversee and participate in the day-to-day operation, maintenance, and repair of all machinery in the engine room.    b. Watchkeeping: Stand watch in the engine control room, ensuring that all engine systems are functioning properly. This includes monitoring gauges, fuel consumption, and other parameters.    c. Troubleshooting: Identify and troubleshoot any technical issues or malfunctions in the engine room equipment. Take corrective actions to resolve problems and ensure smooth operations    d. Routine Maintenance: Execute planned maintenance tasks, including regular inspections, lubrication, and cleaning of machinery. Keep accurate records of maintenance activities.    e. Emergency Response: Be prepared to respond to any emergencies, such as engine failures or other critical situations. Participate in drills and training exercises to ensure the crew is well-prepared for emergencies.     Managerial and Administrative Responsibilities:      a. Supervision: Supervise the work of the engine room crew, providing guidance and support as needed. Coordinate activities to ensure efficient and safe operation.    b. Documentation: Maintain accurate records of engine room activities, including maintenance logs, fuel consumption records, and other relevant documentation required for compliance and reporting.    c. Inventory Management: Manage spare parts and inventory for engine room equipment. Ensure that an adequate supply of spare parts is maintained for essential machinery.    d. Regulatory Compliance: Ensure that all activities in the engine room comply with relevant maritime regulations and industry standards. Stay updated on changes in regulations and implement necessary adjustments.      Communication:      a. Communication with Bridge: Maintain communication with the bridge team to coordinate navigation and propulsion activities. Report any issues or changes in engine status promptly.    b. Team Communication: Foster effective communication within the engine room team and collaborate with other departments on board.      Training and Development:     a. Training: Provide training to junior engineers and engine room personnel. Ensure that all team members are familiar with safety procedures, equipment operation, and emergency protocols.    b. Professional Development: Stay updated on industry developments, new technologies, and best practices in marine engineering. Pursue professional development opportunities to enhance skills and knowledge.     Safety and Environmental Compliance:     a. Safety Procedures: Enforce and adhere to strict safety protocols to prevent accidents and injuries. Conduct safety drills regularly.    b. Environmental Compliance: Ensure compliance with environmental regulations, especially those related to emissions and waste disposal.
column11: Any Graduate, Any Postgraduate
column13: Training, Administration, Spare parts, Compliance, Maritime, Marine engineering, Training and Development, Monitoring

column2: As an IFS (Industrial and Financial Systems) technical professional, your role involves working with the IFS Applications suite, an enterprise resource planning (ERP) software solution, to implement, customize, integrate, and support business processes for your clients or organization. Here's an overview of what your responsibilities might include:Implementation: You would be responsible for implementing the IFS Applications suite according to the specific requirements of your clients or organization. This involves configuring modules such as finance, human capital management, supply chain management, project management, and customer relationship management to meet business needs.Customization: While IFS Applications offers a wide range of functionality out of the box, you may need to customize the software to address unique business requirements. This could involve developing customizations using IFS's development framework, including modifications to forms, workflows, reports, and business logic.Integration: IFS Applications often need to integrate with other systems within an organization's IT landscape, such as legacy systems, third-party software, or external data sources. You would be involved in designing and implementing integration solutions using APIs, middleware, or data connectors to ensure seamless data exchange and workflow automation.Data Management: You would manage data within the IFS Applications suite, including data migration from legacy systems, data cleansing, validation, and ensuring data integrity and security. This may involve developing data migration scripts, performing data mapping, and conducting data quality checks.System Administration: You would perform system administration tasks such as user management, access control, configuration management, and system monitoring to ensure the smooth operation of IFS Applications. This may also include applying patches, upgrades, and troubleshooting technical issues as they arise.Training and Support: You would provide training and support to end-users to ensure they can effectively use IFS Applications to perform their daily tasks. This may involve conducting training sessions, creating documentation, and providing ongoing support to address user questions and issues.Reporting and Analytics: You would leverage the reporting and analytics capabilities of IFS Applications to provide stakeholders with insights into business performance, trends, and key metrics. This may involve designing and developing custom reports, dashboards, and analytics models to support decision-making and strategic planning.Compliance and Regulations: You would ensure that IFS Applications are configured and maintained in compliance with industry regulations, standards, and best practices. This may involve implementing security controls, audit trails, and data encryption to protect sensitive information and ensure regulatory compliance.
column11: Any Graduate, Any Postgraduate
column13: IFS Applications, resource planning, configuration management, system administration, project management, customer relationship, relationship management, supply chain management, system monitoring, strategic planning

column2: Job SummaryA top global technology manufacturer is looking for an IT Solution Architect with expertise in Oracle Global Trade Management (GTM) and Fusion Cloud. This leader will play a critical role in supporting our IT strategies and engaging in the ongoing transformation of our business with our internal and external partners. Fostering strong relationships with strategic internal partners is essential for success. This is both a functional and a technical role requiring the ability to handle complex situations in a dynamic environment, as well as provide solid technical solutions as part of a transformation and modernization effort.Job ResponsibilitiesLead/drive Oracle (GTM) Cloud functional design, technical design, development, and support in manufacturing and supply chain global trade processes.Work with cross-functional teams to implement integrated solutions across Fusion and WMS Cloud platforms as well as legacy eBS and other non-Oracle applications.Perform architect role on Oracle Cloud participating in all phases from envisioning and planning through execution and stabilization.Develop and execute test plans to check infrastructure and systems technical development and make recommendations for improvement.Assist in the identification, analysis, and resolution of major systems defects and bugs.Develop and implement policies, procedures, and architectural controls to ensure that systems support the organization's business requirements and meet the needs of end users while minimizing customizations.Define ERP technical and application architectures, participate in integration points and technology processes to architect and deploy solutions.Prioritize, scope, and negotiate time and effort requirements for project and enhancement demand pipeline while facilitating estimation of business benefits.QualificationsMinimum of 8+ years of experience providing functional solutions, architecting, and implementing Oracle GTM cloud with integration to Oracle eBS and/or Oracle Fusion Cloud.Oracle Transportation Management (OTM) Cloud solutioning and implementation experience preferred.Solid understanding of Logistics and Trade business processes party and sanctioned party screening, export compliance, product classification, shipping, receiving, and warehousing/distribution.Excellent problem solving and critical thinking skills.Strong business acumen and understanding of ERP from both functional and implementation perspectives.Polished communication skills enabling effective interactions with business and technical audiences, with ability to tailor messaging to varied audiences.Ability to prioritize tasks and work autonomously in a fast-paced environment.Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Business, or Engineering; Masters or MBA degree is preferred

column2: Oversee and manage the safe and efficient operations of the company's fleet of vessels   Ensure compliance with international maritime regulations, industry standards, and company policies   Coordinate vessel inspections, audits, and surveys to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry best practices   Develop and implement operational procedures and guidelines to enhance safety, environmental protection, and efficiency in vessel operations   Monitor vessel performance, including fuel consumption, voyage planning, and maintenance activities, and provide recommendations for optimization   Conduct regular assessments of the competency and proficiency of vessel crew members, and coordinate training programs as needed   Collaborate with shipyards and contractors for vessel repairs, maintenance, and dry-docking activities, ensuring adherence to quality standards and project timelines   Manage and analyze operational data, including incident reports, near misses, and performance indicators, to identify trends and implement corrective actions   Support the procurement and inspection of marine equipment, spare parts, and supplies to ensure availability and compliance with quality standards   Act as a liaison with regulatory authorities, classification societies, and flag state administrations to ensure compliance and maintain necessary certifications   Monitor and implement changes in international maritime regulations and industry guidelines, and communicate relevant updates to the fleet and internal stakeholders   Provide technical expertise and support for vessel upgrades, modifications, and new vessel construction projects   Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marine engineering, logistics, and safety departments, to optimize vessel operations and ensure effective communication and coordination   Participate in incident investigations and provide recommendations for prevention and improvement    Requirements:    Bachelor's degree in Maritime Studies, Nautical Science, Marine Engineering, or a related field   Relevant seafaring experience, preferably in a senior officer or captain position   Proven experience (X+ years) as a Marine Superintendent or in a similar marine operations management role   In-depth knowledge of international maritime regulations, industry standards, and best practices   Familiarity with vessel types and operations, including cargo vessels, tankers, or offshore support vessels   Strong understanding of safety management systems, risk assessment, and incident investigation   Excellent communication and leadership skills to effectively interact with vessel crews, contractors, and internal stakeholders   Analytical and problem-solving abilities to identify and resolve operational challenges   Familiarity with marine maintenance and repair procedures, including dry-docking and class surveys   Proficiency in using marine software and systems for vessels and shipyards as required

column2: Department- LogisticsJob Context & Major Challenges: 1. Physical inspection and loading activities in shifts. 2. Yard management and stacking and movement, shifting of material with weigh check. 3. Segregation and sorted material inspection and photography. 4. Unloading of inwards / returns and handover to production with records 5. Checking of compliance adherence for vehicles, transaction like e-way etc. 6. Inventory Management  Stacking with gradation / weight and daily physical check in coordination with production. 7. Ensure to maintain overall TAT of all copper vehicles, safety /SOP adherences.  Key Result Areas / Accountabilities  & Supporting Actions :- 1) Dispatch Documentation -  Physical inspection of loaded material  Making documents / invoices etc as per orders in SAP  Guide to loading staff for correct loading  Generation of accurate documents and check before hand over. Maintain shift dispatch target and TAT of activities. Manual E waybill generation 2) Operational Excellence -  Prepare document as per loading instruction after checks.  Ensure loading of the vehicle in minimum time to maintain TAT. Scanning and physical tally of loaded material  Filed supervision for correct product, quantity, grade loading. Truck release with proper lashing and tarpaulin  Focus full capacity of truck space utilization with product mix. Loading Photograph to be taken of vehicles/ Drivers  . 3) Compliance / Safety -  Follow the compliance with respect to statutes, quality certification norms, health, safety, and environment norms  Ensure to adhere compliances wrt statutes and HSE norms. Adherence to Safety, issue of E -permits, MOCs and SOPs   4) Customer-centricity -  Timely Safe and intact loading of material in Vehicles  Correct product loading with intact condition as per orderEnsure lashing and tarpaulin done properly   5) Sustainability and Process Improvement  -  Innovate and implement re-using of things without compromising on quality, reduce costs. Participating in Kaizen and other such improvement initiatives  Implementing 5S and good housekeeping in the department Partnering creation and maintenance of Green Belt  . 6) People development and engagement  -  Imparting training team members to enhance safety awareness.  Implementing 5S work culture.  Development of 2nd line for SI activities. Controlling and monitoring of Gate no 5 team (by product dispatch offices)  .

column2: A Master Mariner, often referred to as a Captain, is a highly experienced and qualified professional responsible for the safe and efficient operation of a ship at sea    This role involves a combination of navigational and managerial duties        Here is a comprehensive job description for a Master Mariner:      Navigation and Seamanship:Plan and execute safe and efficient navigation of the vessel, considering weather conditions, traffic, and any other potential hazards.Ensure compliance with international and local maritime regulations.Supervise and train deck officers and crew in navigation procedures and safety protocols.Conduct regular navigational assessments and drills.    Safety and Emergency Response:Implement and enforce safety policies and procedures to ensure the well-being of the crew, passengers, and the vessel.Coordinate and lead emergency response drills and exercises.Take immediate and effective action in emergency situations to ensure the safety of the vessel and its occupants.    Crew Management:Supervise and manage the ship's crew, including hiring, training, and evaluating performance.Foster a positive working environment and maintain effective communication among the crew.Ensure compliance with labor and employment regulations.    Operational Management:Oversee the loading and unloading of cargo, ensuring proper stowage and securing.Manage the ship's budget, including expenditures on fuel, provisions, and maintenance.Keep accurate records of the ship's activities, including cargo operations, maintenance, and crew movements.    Communication and Reporting:Maintain regular communication with shore-based authorities, such as port authorities and shipping companies.Prepare and submit reports as required by regulatory bodies and the ship's owners.    Navigation Equipment and Technology:Ensure that the ship's navigation and communication equipment is properly maintained and in good working order.Stay updated on advancements in navigation technology and implement relevant improvements on board.    Environmental Responsibility:Adhere to environmental regulations and implement practices to minimize the ship's impact on the environment.Manage waste disposal in accordance with international standards.    Legal and Regulatory Compliance:Stay informed about and ensure compliance with international maritime laws, regulations, and conventions.Maintain required certifications and licenses.    Crisis Management:Develop and implement crisis management plans to address potential risks and emergencies.Collaborate with relevant authorities in case of incidents, accidents, or investigations.    Professional Development:Pursue continuous professional development and training to stay abreast of industry trends and advancements.
column11: Any Graduate, Any Postgraduate
column13: Training, Crisis management, Operations management, cargo operations, Maritime, Legal, Regulatory compliance, Manager Technology, Management

column2: Job Description :  This Applications Developer will collaborate proactively with functional analysts to translate business and integration requirements into configurable component designs and solutions.  This position will code,  unit test,  implement and support these enterprise application solutions.  The ideal candidate will reflect a mix of strong technical proficiency,  application maintenance ownership,  and the ability to work effectively with other business and technology personnel and internal customers to provide very responsive support to this global application.  This candidate will be working in a Matrix management environment reporting to both EMEA On- site and Off- shore managers.  The Developer will report to the track Manager of the Applications Analyst Group and in dotted line to ITC track lead.  The position will work with the IS Applications EMEA Team,  collaborating with Business Users in testing,  executing application enhancements and small projects.  The position will play an integral part in the company s initiatives including but not limited to Requirements understanding.  Ability to initially test of developed solutions The ability to interview various non- technical managers to understand complex,  dynamic business rules/ process and then create detailed,  specific and comprehensive documentation.  Project Team,  Developer Team and Production Support Team to design and implement an effective solution.  Manage components of a project plan or smaller projects Strong functional understanding of the systems supported and the development framework for customizations Verification of feasibility of Business User s request functionality and business rules based on existing technical systems and data structures.  Ability to understand and use in day to day activities  Scope Documents Use Cases Detailed Specification of Key Business Rules  Activity Diagrams  Business Process Mapping Diagrams and Documentation Application Gap analysis The role will also imply providing 2nd or 3rd level Help Desk support to user community.  QUALIFICATIONS  The following are the minimum qualifications which an individual needs in order to successfully perform the duties and responsibilities of this position.  Bachelors degree in a technical/ business discipline with 2 to 4 years practical technical/ functional experience and 2+ lifecycle implementations Experience 2 years of experience and expertise in Oracle ERP applications. Hands on work experience in understanding primarily core Finance modules (AP/ GL/ AR/ FA) and secondary Order Management,  Shipping,  Pricing and Inventory is required.  Knowledge in Finance R12 is preferred Experience in onsite/ offshore model is preferred Excellent technical skills with  SOA Fusion Middleware technology Using Jdeveloper for ADF /  OAF Framework solutions Using PL/ SQL in 10 and 11g,  SQL,  Workflow 2.x,  Forms and Reports 6i  XML Publisher Unix/ Linux,  Shell scripting Visio Perfect understanding concepts of relational databases and database objects Complete mastery of Entity Relationship Diagrams (ERDs) and the translation of business requirements into them Experience with change management tools and processes,  including source code control,  versioning,  branching,  defect tracking and release management.  Good knowledge and understanding of Oracle Application API s  In- depth knowledge of applications code tuning methodology  Experience with global implementations of Oracle Applications Highly Desired International experience,  in working with Shared Service Center Knowledge/ experience of integrations with Oracle 11i /  R12 applications and legacy systems

column2: Sea and Beyond is looking for 3rd Engineer / 4th Engineer to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.    Third Engineer      Rank and Hierarchy:The Third Engineer is a licensed officer and holds a higher rank than the Fourth Engineer.Reports to the Chief Engineer.    Responsibilities:Assists the Second Engineer in overseeing the daily operation, maintenance, and repair of the ship's machinery and equipment.Monitors and controls the engine room under the direction of the Chief Engineer.Conducts routine inspections, tests, and maintenance of various machinery components.Operates and maintains auxiliary machinery, including pumps, compressors, and generators.May be responsible for the supervision of junior engineering staff.    Watchkeeping:Usually stands watch in the engine room, ensuring that all machinery is operating efficiently and addressing any issues that may arise.    Paperwork and Documentation:Maintains accurate records of engine room operations, including fuel consumption, maintenance activities, and equipment performance.    Emergency Response:Participates in emergency drills and is trained to respond effectively to engine room emergencies.      Fourth Engineer      The Fourth Engineer is typically an entry-level position for licensed engineers.Reports to the Second Engineer or Third Engineer.    Responsibilities:Assists higher-ranking engineers in the maintenance and repair of the ship's machinery.Performs routine checks on machinery and systems.Operates and maintains equipment under the supervision of higher-ranking engineers.May be involved in the watchkeeping routine in the engine room.    Training and Development:Often a training position for less experienced engineers working towards higher ranks.    Assistance:Assists in the execution of maintenance and repair tasks as directed by senior engineering officers.    Emergency Response:Participates in emergency drills and learns to respond to engine room emergencies.
column11: Any Graduate, Any Postgraduate
column13: Pumps, Training and Development, Supervision

column2: Job Brief     Preparing all required Pastry recipe as instructed following the Menus, Recipes, Guidelines & Methods provided.    Must be able to take on basic tasks (creams, ice-cream, and preparation of basic dough s) and techniques (piping bag, knife handling skills).     Operational :     Preparing all required Pastry recipe as instructed following the Menus, Recipes, Guidelines & Methods provided.    Must be able to take on basic tasks (creams, ice-cream, and preparation of basic dough s) and techniques (piping bag, knife handling skills).   Maintain a safe and clean work environment by complying with USPH and Company Regulations.    Must be able to work in any section of the Pastry Department and demonstrate methods and recipes to his / her subordinates.    Produces and maintains the expected level of food quality in his / her area of responsibility as per the Pastry Chef instructions.    Ensure immaculate cleanliness in the Pastry / Bakery Department and adjacent areas, by applying safe work practices, procedures according to USPH Regulations and prevent any equipment damages / loss.   Responsible to control and maintain all Pastry equipment, ensuring that it s cleaned / sanitized and returned in an acceptable and proper condition after each use.    Responsible for all Pastry Equipment in terms of handling and storage.    Any damages and / or malfunctions must be justified, recorded and reported.    Ensure that the pastry and adjacent areas are ready for any announced and / or unannounced USPH inspection, done either by the Ships Management or local authorities (public health inspectors).    Ensures that the HACCP program is applied accordingly.    Must have a thorough understanding of how TAR operates.      Training & Development :     Attends meetings, training activities, courses and all other work-related activities as required.      Financial :     Responsible for cost containment through the proper use, handling and maintenance of records, reports, supplies and equipment within his assigned section.     Safety Responsibilities :     Ensure that all safety procedures are adhered to, cooperating with the Staff Captain in the Ship s Safety Program at all times and that they all follow the Ships Rules & Regulations.
