column2: A Technical Superintendent is a key role in the maritime industry, specifically within the shipping or maritime operations sector    They are responsible for overseeing the technical aspects of vessel operations and ensuring that ships are maintained and operated in compliance with industry regulations and standards    Here are the primary responsibilities of a Technical Superintendent:Vessel Maintenance and Repairs: Technical Superintendents are responsible for coordinating and supervising the maintenance, repair, and dry-docking activities of vessels under their management    They develop maintenance plans, monitor the condition of machinery and equipment, and schedule necessary repairs to ensure the safe and efficient operation of the vessels    Compliance with Regulations: They ensure that vessels comply with various international and national regulations, classification society requirements, and industry standards    They keep abreast of regulatory changes, implement necessary modifications or upgrades, and oversee inspections and audits to maintain compliance    Budgeting and Cost Control: Technical Superintendents manage the budget for vessel maintenance and repair activities    They prepare cost estimates, analyze expenses, and control costs to ensure efficient allocation of resources    They may also liaise with suppliers and negotiate contracts to obtain competitive pricing for services and spare parts    Spare Parts and Inventory Management: They oversee the procurement, storage, and management of spare parts, consumables, and supplies required for vessel operations    They maintain inventory levels, coordinate with suppliers, and ensure timely availability of necessary items to minimize downtime    Crew Training and Development: Technical Superintendents provide guidance and support to vessel crews regarding technical operations, maintenance procedures, and safety protocols    They may organize training programs or workshops to enhance the skills and knowledge of the onboard technical staff    Safety and Environmental Compliance: They enforce safety procedures and ensure that vessels comply with environmental regulations, including pollution prevention measures    They monitor the implementation of safety management systems and conduct risk assessments to mitigate potential hazards    Performance Monitoring: Technical Superintendents analyze vessel performance data, such as fuel consumption, machinery efficiency, and voyage analysis    They identify areas for improvement and implement measures to optimize vessel performance, reduce fuel consumption, and enhance operational efficiency    Emergency Response and Crisis Management: They contribute to emergency response planning and crisis management procedures    They work closely with vessel crews, onboard officers, and shore-based teams to develop contingency plans, conduct drills, and respond effectively to emergency situations    Technical Documentation and Reporting: They maintain accurate records and documentation related to vessel operations, maintenance activities, inspections, and repairs    They prepare technical reports, including condition assessment reports, repair status reports, and maintenance history reports for internal and external stakeholders    Technical Support and Troubleshooting: Technical Superintendents provide technical support and guidance to onboard personnel and shore-based teams    They assist in troubleshooting technical issues, identify root causes of problems, and recommend appropriate solutions or repairs
column11: Any Graduate, Any Postgraduate
column13: Procurement, Technical Superintendent, Crisis management, Spare parts, Maritime, Troubleshooting, Operations, Technical support, Technical documentation

column2: SAP EWM (Extended Warehouse Management) is a comprehensive software solution designed to optimize and automate warehouse and distribution center processes within organizations. As a SAP EWM consultant or professional, your role involves configuring, implementing, and supporting SAP EWM to meet the specific needs of your clients or organization. Here's an overview of your responsibilities and tasks:Solution Design and Configuration: You would collaborate with clients to understand their warehouse operations, requirements, and goals. Based on this analysis, you would design the SAP EWM solution architecture and configure the system to support warehouse processes such as inbound and outbound logistics, inventory management, storage bin management, picking, packing, and shipping.Master Data Setup: You would set up master data within SAP EWM, including product master data, storage bin configurations, warehouse structures, and handling unit profiles. This involves defining warehouse layout, storage types, storage sections, storage bins, and assigning appropriate attributes to each storage bin based on material characteristics and storage requirements.Integration: SAP EWM integrates closely with other SAP modules such as SAP ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning), SAP SCM (Supply Chain Management), SAP TM (Transportation Management), and SAP TM (Event Management), as well as with external systems such as barcode scanners, RFID (Radio Frequency Identification) systems, and material handling equipment (MHE). You would be responsible for ensuring seamless integration between SAP EWM and these systems to enable data exchange and process automation.Custom Development: While SAP EWM provides standard functionality for warehouse management processes, you may need to develop custom enhancements or interfaces to address unique business requirements. This could involve writing ABAP code, developing custom reports, or configuring custom workflows within the SAP EWM solution.User Training and Support: You would provide training and support to warehouse personnel on how to use SAP EWM effectively to perform their daily tasks. This may involve conducting training sessions, creating user documentation, and providing ongoing support to address user questions and issues.Testing and Validation: You would conduct testing and validation of the SAP EWM solution to ensure that it meets the specified requirements and functions correctly in different scenarios. This may involve unit testing, integration testing, user acceptance testing, and regression testing to identify and resolve any issues before the system goes live.Performance Optimization: You would optimize the performance of SAP EWM to ensure efficient warehouse operations and timely processing of transactions. This may involve tuning system configurations, optimizing database performance, and identifying and resolving performance bottlenecks.Continuous Improvement: After the initial implementation, you would continue to optimize and enhance the SAP EWM solution based on feedback, changing business requirements, and emerging best practices. This may involve conducting regular performance reviews, implementing system upgrades, and exploring opportunities for automation and process improvement.
column11: Any Graduate, Any Postgraduate
column13: SAP EWM, sap scm, shipping, supply chain management, warehouse operations, warehouse management, transport management, outbound logistics, inventory management, transportation

column2: Your role:Are you passionate about delivering change? Are you detail oriented and a great communicator? Do you want to work closely with senior management across the Supply Chain organization and beyond? Are you motivated by to have meaningful impact on the forward looking success of the function? If so, we would like to meet you as we are looking for someone like you to support the running of our Supply Chain Data Management and Analytics Office.We are looking for a candidate to help us:Design, develop and troubleshoot ETL workflows, datasets and processes related to Alteryx for the Data Management and Analytics workstreamSupport escalations for Data Management and analytics workstreams in Supply Chain and to embed data quality across Supply Chain central IT platformsPrepare technical specifications and documentation for Alteryx workflows supporting BI reportsWork closely with various stakeholders including Contract Managers and Risk Domain owners to identify and prioritise their Key Data Elements, Data Owners and Data Controls to drive data qualityOversee additional resources who will be executing a legacy clean-up on our data and report progress against plansWork closely with the wider TPRM Programme and Risk Domain owners to report progress against plans and status reportingData modeling - Use Alteryx to create a repeatable ETL and data model to serve data to Tableau dashboardsYour team:You will be working in Corporate Centre within the Supply Chain organisation. This role sits within the Data Management and Analytics workstream, which operates out of London. This workstream is responsible for working directly with the Business, Risk Domain owners and supply chain leadership to ensure that the data we hold within our central repository has good data quality and helps create analytics based insights to assist with strategic decisions.Your expertise:You should have an understanding of Supply Chain and Data Management and Analytics and Reporting within a financial services setting.Hands-on skills and experience in Alteryx Designer, Alteryx Server, and the tools with Alteryx such as Predictive, Parsing, and TransformAt least 8 years of experience in Financial Services, Consultancy or Data management and analytics within other IndustriesExperience in connecting and working with different types of data sources, for example, SQL and APIsAbility to design reports from scratch and use BI tools like Tableau and PowerBIAbility to perform quantitative analysis, data extrapolation, and data mining to drive insightsListening to different views and facilitate decision makingStrong organisation, project and programme management skillsGood stakeholder management skills, with experience of interacting and influencing senior managementKnowledge of data governance and data management (desirable, not essential)

column2: SAP EWM (Extended Warehouse Management) is a comprehensive software solution designed to optimize and automate warehouse and distribution center processes within organizations. As a SAP EWM consultant or professional, your role involves configuring, implementing, and supporting SAP EWM to meet the specific needs of your clients or organization. Here's an overview of your responsibilities and tasks:Solution Design and Configuration: You would collaborate with clients to understand their warehouse operations, requirements, and goals. Based on this analysis, you would design the SAP EWM solution architecture and configure the system to support warehouse processes such as inbound and outbound logistics, inventory management, storage bin management, picking, packing, and shipping.Master Data Setup: You would set up master data within SAP EWM, including product master data, storage bin configurations, warehouse structures, and handling unit profiles. This involves defining warehouse layout, storage types, storage sections, storage bins, and assigning appropriate attributes to each storage bin based on material characteristics and storage requirements.Integration: SAP EWM integrates closely with other SAP modules such as SAP ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning), SAP SCM (Supply Chain Management), SAP TM (Transportation Management), and SAP TM (Event Management), as well as with external systems such as barcode scanners, RFID (Radio Frequency Identification) systems, and material handling equipment (MHE). You would be responsible for ensuring seamless integration between SAP EWM and these systems to enable data exchange and process automation.Custom Development: While SAP EWM provides standard functionality for warehouse management processes, you may need to develop custom enhancements or interfaces to address unique business requirements. This could involve writing ABAP code, developing custom reports, or configuring custom workflows within the SAP EWM solution.User Training and Support: You would provide training and support to warehouse personnel on how to use SAP EWM effectively to perform their daily tasks. This may involve conducting training sessions, creating user documentation, and providing ongoing support to address user questions and issues.Testing and Validation: You would conduct testing and validation of the SAP EWM solution to ensure that it meets the specified requirements and functions correctly in different scenarios. This may involve unit testing, integration testing, user acceptance testing, and regression testing to identify and resolve any issues before the system goes live.Performance Optimization: You would optimize the performance of SAP EWM to ensure efficient warehouse operations and timely processing of transactions. This may involve tuning system configurations, optimizing database performance, and identifying and resolving performance bottlenecks.Continuous Improvement: After the initial implementation, you would continue to optimize and enhance the SAP EWM solution based on feedback, changing business requirements, and emerging best practices. This may involve conducting regular performance reviews, implementing system upgrades, and exploring opportunities for automation and process improvement.
column11: Any Graduate, Any Postgraduate
column13: SAP EWM, sap scm, shipping, supply chain management, warehouse operations, warehouse management, transport management, outbound logistics, inventory management, transportation

Lead initiatives to assess and improve vessel and operator quality and efficiency. Serve as a champion for marine vessel operator quality.    ??Lead and/or participate in risk assessment and hazard ID initiatives relating to marine vessel operations.    ??Support corporate industry advocacy efforts in the field of vessel operations through participation in industry organizations such as OCIMF and SIGTTO.    ??Evaluation of potential new ports and terminals.    ??Evaluation of STS operators/service providers for all liquid cargos.    ??Support resolution of marine issues relating to terminal interfaces.    ??Provide expert guidance on the operational, navigational, cargo / ballast and mooring related activities in the carriage of LNG / Oil / Chemicals or DP operations.    ??Support the development and implementation of systems to deliver safe and compliant marine operations at sites across client spheres of operation.    ??Support the identification and management of risk associated with marine operations, always striving to embrace continuous improvement to minimise operational risk to client.    ??Ensure both Assets and vessels comply with local, National, and International maritime legislation inclusive of Classification Society and Flag State requirements.    ??Responsible for facilitating both internal and external audits and agreeing any resulting actions and applicable closure dates.    ??Establish and maintain effective relationships with others ensuring effective collaboration with the various Technical Authorities (Marine, Engineering, Floating Structure, Floating Systems etc) HSSE Teams based within client.    ??Assist in the preparation of policy and procedural documents as directed and agreed.    ??You may be asked from time to time be asked to undertake other tasks that are considered to be relevant to your position.

column2: Job Title: AccountantLocation: KurlaKey Responsibilities:Financial Transaction Management: Responsible for recording all income and expenses, accurately entering financial data into the accounting system, and maintaining comprehensive financial records.Account Reconciliation: Perform regular account reconciliations to ensure accuracy and completeness of financial data. Balance accounts and verify that all transactions are properly recorded and accounted for.Financial Reporting: Prepare financial statements, reports, and forecasts to provide management with valuable insights into the company's financial performance and health. column2: Sea and Beyond is looking for2nd / 3rd / 4th Engineers to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.    2nd Engineer:      Senior Responsibilities:      The 2nd Engineer is a senior officer responsible for assisting the Chief Engineer in managing and supervising the engineering department    Watchkeeping: They stand watch over the engine room and machinery spaces during designated periods to ensure the safe and efficient operation of the ship's engines, boilers, and other mechanical systems    Maintenance and Repairs: In charge of overseeing routine maintenance and repairs of the ship's machinery, including propulsion systems, power generation, and auxiliary equipment    Training and Supervision: Provides guidance and supervision to junior engineering officers and ratings    Ensures that the engineering team is properly trained and follows safety procedures    Documentation: Maintains accurate records and documentation related to engine room operations, fuel consumption, maintenance, and repairs      3rd Engineer:      Operational Duties:      The 3rd Engineer assists the 2nd Engineer in day-to-day operations of the engine room, including watchkeeping and maintenance tasks    System Monitoring: Monitors and maintains the ship's auxiliary machinery, such as pumps, compressors, and purifiers, ensuring they operate efficiently    Troubleshooting: Assists in troubleshooting and diagnosing mechanical issues and participates in the repair and maintenance of machinery    Safety Compliance: Ensures that safety and environmental regulations are followed in the engine room    Participates in emergency response drills      4th Engineer:      The 4th Engineer is usually an entry-level position in the engineering department, responsible for assisting higher-ranked engineers    Assistance in Maintenance: Participates in routine maintenance tasks, overhauls, and repairs under the guidance of senior engineering officers    Monitoring and Operation: Operates and monitors machinery and systems under the supervision of higher-ranking engineers    Training: Engages in ongoing training and development to acquire the skills and knowledge necessary for higher-ranking positions

of supply chain planning processes and a proven track record of successful SAP SNP implementations    If you are passionate about supply chain optimization and have expertise in SAP SNP modules, we column2: A logistic coordinator plays a crucial role in managing and coordinating the logistics operations of a company or organization    They are responsible for ensuring the smooth flow of goods, services, or information from the point of origin to the final destination    The specific job duties and responsibilities may vary depending on the industry and organization, but here are some common tasks associated with the role of a logistic coordinator:Planning and Scheduling: Logistic coordinators are responsible for planning and scheduling the transportation of goods or services    This includes determining the most efficient routes, modes of transportation, and delivery schedules to meet customer requirements and minimize costs    Coordination: They coordinate with various stakeholders, such as suppliers, vendors, shipping companies, and internal departments, to ensure timely delivery of goods    This involves monitoring shipments, tracking inventory levels, and resolving any issues or delays that may arise during transportation    Documentation: Logistic coordinators prepare and maintain documentation related to logistics activities    They ensure that all necessary permits, licenses, customs documentation, and shipping records are accurately completed and maintained in compliance with applicable regulations    Inventory Management: They monitor inventory levels, conduct regular stock checks, and coordinate with warehouse personnel to ensure adequate stock availability    Logistic coordinators also analyze inventory data and make recommendations for optimizing inventory levels and minimizing storage costs    Cost Optimization: They work to optimize logistics costs by analyzing transportation rates, negotiating contracts with suppliers and carriers, and identifying cost-saving opportunities    Logistic coordinators may also be involved in budgeting and financial analysis related to logistics operations
column11: Any Graduate, Any Postgraduate
column13: Logistic Coordinator, Financial analysis, Inventory management, Scheduling, Logistics operations, Budgeting, Cost optimization, Monitoring, Inventory, Logistics

column2: To support assigned suppliers to meet and/or exceed the quality performance standards and our customers product quality expectations by investigating, analyzing, and resolving supplier quality problems.   To lead in all supplier qualification endeavors including on-site supplier quality audits and supplier technical reviews.   To drive the systematic quality process in the NPI phase to meet and/or exceed Supplier PPAP "First Time Right" metrics.    JOB RESPONSIBILITIES of Supply Quality Engineer     Supplier Qualification, Approval and Maintenance     Lead on-site audits focusing on both quality systems and technical processes   Conduct technical reviews at the part level to access the suppliers capability to take part   Drive post-audit corrective actions    NPI - Part development    Drive systematic Quality Processes to meet project timeline and PPAP requirements   Help supplier to exceed "Fit, Form, Function" as well as reliability requirements while working with IBCC purchasing, manufacturing and project engineering teams    Supplier Quality Management Supplier Process improvement    Continuously monitor and improve supplier quality performance   Champion problem-solving and root-cause analysis activities with suppliers to avoid repeat failures   Drive a "Zero" defect approach within the supply base and strive to exceed the "Zero PPM" quality level    Supplier Warranty Reduction     Work with Technical service and supplier recovery team to gather, analyze and action all field issues related to assigned suppliers   Lead required problem-solving efforts to eliminate warranty failures   Desired Profile / Criteria / Skills :    Required Qualifications of the Supply Quality Engineer:     A minimum of 8 years experience in quality management in the manufacturing industry involved in casting/forging / machined components subassemblies etc.   Medium to a high level of expertise within Casting and Forging Commodity   Expertise in inspection techniques: Knowledge of visual, 2D 3D dimensional inspection should have knowledge of international inspection standards and specifications for visual, and dimensional checks for the cast, forged and machined components including limits fit and tolerances, etc.    ?   Good knowledge in the inspection of steel castings specifically in cast / machined condition.   ISO 9001-2008 quality management system mastery over quality control, and problem-solving techniques for casting, and forging components. Knowledge of key failure modes for castings and forging processes, problem diagnosis and resolution, standards and tolerance for each process   Understand a variety of casting processes including hot and cold form, permanent and semipermanent, investment and die casting, ductile iron, Grey cast iron, and heat treatment processes    Preferred Qualifications of the Supply Quality Engineer:     Able to review the gating design and potential improvements including the sample casting process,    Familiarity with tooling design (mold pattern), and recommend design modifications or equipment repair   Experience working with customers, suppliers, leading supply chain quality improvement efforts   Experience driving cross-functional business processes   International exposure and/or experience desirable    Education of the Supply Quality Engineer:    Bachelors degree in Mechanical engineering or manufacturing, advanced "Metallurgy" knowledge is highly desirable   Advanced Oral/Written English communication skills
column11: B.Tech/B.E. in Any Specialization, Any Graduate, Any Postgraduate
column13: Supply chain, Product quality, Heat treatment, Quality systems, Process improvement, Resin, PPAP, Metallurgy, Die casting, Supplier quality

column2: As a Logistics Officer, your role is to manage and coordinate various aspects of the logistics and supply chain operations within an organization     Your responsibilities may vary depending on the specific industry and organization you work for, but here are some common tasks and responsibilities associated with the role of a     Logistics Officer:Inventory Management: Overseeing the management of inventory levels to ensure optimal stock levels are maintained    This involves monitoring inventory levels, forecasting demand, and coordinating with suppliers to ensure timely replenishment    Supply Chain Coordination: Coordinating and liaising with suppliers, manufacturers, and distributors to ensure the smooth flow of goods and materials throughout the supply chain    This includes managing purchase orders, tracking shipments, and resolving any supply chain issues or delays    Transportation and Distribution: Planning and managing the transportation and distribution of goods and materials    This involves coordinating with carriers, scheduling shipments, optimizing routes, and ensuring timely delivery while minimizing costs    Warehouse Management: Overseeing warehouse operations, including receiving, storage, and distribution of goods    This includes managing warehouse staff, optimizing storage space, implementing efficient inventory management systems, and ensuring compliance with safety and security standards    Logistics Analysis: Analyzing logistics data and performance metrics to identify areas for improvement and cost-saving opportunities    This may involve conducting cost-benefit analyses, optimizing logistics processes, and implementing continuous improvement initiatives    Risk Management: Assessing and mitigating risks associated with logistics operations    This includes identifying potential risks, developing contingency plans, and ensuring compliance with regulations and legal requirements related to transportation, import/export, and customs
column11: Any Graduate, Any Postgraduate
column13: Supply chain, Compliance, Supply chain operations, Inventory management, Scheduling, Warehouse management, Risk management, Continuous improvement, Forecasting, Monitoring

column2: Job Description :     The Application Analyst is a versatile and highly motivated individual who works with the Business Users and Development team on the functional requirements definition, design, implementation and maintenance of systems applications.   The position will work with the IS Applications EMEA Team, collaborating with Business Users and Developers in defining, prioritizing and executing application enhancements and projects.   Additionally the position will be play the critical role of ensuring that Developers and Production Support Engineers have adequate clarification and support on all business and functional requirements and specifications related to applications.   The Application Analyst will report to the Manager of the Applications Analyst Group.   The position will play an integral part in the company s initiatives including but not limited to  Requirements gathering and scope definition with non-technical Business User constituencies.   The ability to interview various non-technical managers to understand complex, dynamic business rules/process and then create detailed, specific and comprehensive documentation.   Engage Business Users spanning multiple business units and ensure cohesive articulation of business goals and processes to ensure effective Internet solution.   Engage Business Users to support all necessary clarification for the Project Team, Developer Team and Production Support Team to design and implement an effective solution.   Manage components of a project plan or smaller projects  Strong functional understanding of the systems supported and the development framework for customizations  Verification of feasibility of Business User s request functionality and business rules based on existing technical systems and data structures.   Ability to create and present key requirements artifacts:   Scope Documents  Use Cases  Detailed Specification of Key Business Rules   Activity Diagrams   Business Process Mapping Diagrams and Documentation  Application Gap analysis  The role will also imply providing 2nd or 3rd level Help Desk support to user community.    QUALIFICATIONS  Bachelors degree in a technical/business discipline with 2 to 4 years practical technical/functional experience and 2+ lifecycle implementations   Skills  Knowledge with Oracle Applications modules related to the Order Management, Telesales, Shipment Execution process and Inventory.   Experience in Customer Relationship Management modules (CRM).   Knowledge and experience in SOA is preferred.   Knowledge of business flows implementations like Order - to - Cash  Some knowledge in the Finance modules is preferred. Knowledge of Vertex TAX Engine is appreciated.   As a knowledgeable expert act as an analyst for the team members and key business users  Knowledge of Oracle Application functionality, schemas and development frameworks  Knowledge of Oracle Application configurations  Knowledge of working in a Multi-Organization environment inside the Oracle Applications  Knowledge of the AIM Methodology  Knowledge with SQL based queries and the application framework of Oracle applications  Knowledge with global implementations of Oracle applications  Good written and verbal communication skills, Fluent in English  Good interpersonal skills  Ability to gracefully manage multiple priorities, commitments and projects in fast-paced dynamic environment  Ability to self-motivate and self-manage  Positive, pro-active, eager to learn, flexible, customer- and service-oriented, team player and team builder  Leading skills on identifying system impact for small and large scale initiatives  Knowledge of Project and/or Software Development Life Cycle  Good users of Microsoft Office, Visio, and Primavera  Knowledge in creating estimates for functional extensions   Highly Desired  Previous experience in this role servicing large multinational corporations ($2B+ revenue) either as an internal employee or as a consultant  International experience and Fluency in other European languages  In the role as analyst coach the members in the same track  Knowledge/experience of integrations with Oracle 11i /R12 applications and legacy systems

column2: DCS Engineer is the overall In charge of the DCS activity in the shift. He closely monitor and control the process parameter and give the instruction to field (Reactor and Dryer) engineer for the routine/non-routine activity. He is responsible to achieve desired Product Quality within the shift.     S/He takes corrective action against the process deviation and maintain the healthy plant conditions.     S/He is responsible to inform the change/deviation in process parameter to shift in-charge.     In the absence of Shift In charge.     S/He is acting as Shift in charge. column2: Responsibilities:       We are currently seeking a detail-oriented and experienced US Accountant to join our finance team.       The ideal candidate will have a strong background in accounting and financial management, particularly within the IT and Staffing industry in USA.       As a US Accountant, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the accurate financial management of our US operations. Your responsibilities will encompass a wide range of accounting tasks, including:       Managing the daily operations of the US accounting department to ensure efficient and accurate financial processes.       Coordinating with internal teams to assess project billing statuses before each payroll cycle.       Timesheet management, coordination, and preparation of payroll sheets, including time hours, billable rates, and payment percentages.       Validation and processing of Accounts Receivable (AR) and Accounts Payable (AP) invoices.       Reconciliation of customer payments and deductions related to insurance companies and consultant payroll calculations.       Handling customer inquiries related to invoices, net terms, and net term deductions.       Utilizing QuickBooks (Online & Desktop) accounting software or ADP Payroll for payroll processing, including adding, changing, and terminating assignments.       Generating financial reports and management information system (MIS) reports.       Preparation of employee W2, 1099 accounts, and balance sheets.       Reporting on accrual profit and other financial metrics.       Ensuring timely and accurate payment processing for AP/AR invoices.       Maintaining accurate records of checks received and online payments, and applying transactions in QuickBooks.       Collaborating with customers on payment-related issues and coordinating with insurance companies.Required Qualifications:       To excel in this role, candidates should possess the following qualifications:       Masters Degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business Administration OR completion of CA Inter/CA Finals.       Extensive years of relevant accounting and financial experience, preferably within the IT and Staffing industry.       Experience working as an intern under a Practicing CA.       Good understanding of Staffing Business operations is a plus. Advanced knowledge of QuickBooks (Online & Desktop) accounting software or ADP Payroll for payroll processing.       Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.       Detail-oriented mindset with a focus on accuracy and timeliness.Requirements that will be needed to be a part of this team:       Candidates with the following skills and experiences will be given preference:       Familiarity with US GAAP accounting principles. Previous experience in processing US payroll and managing timesheets.       Proficiency in using financial software tools and spreadsheets.       Excellent organizational skills and the ability to work independently.       Strong analytical skills and a proactive approach to problem-solving.       Understanding of net terms, deductions, and invoicing processes.       Demonstrated ability to deliver high-quality work under tight deadlines.  Walk In Timings : 5.30 PM to 7.30 PMVenue : W3 Global India Pvt. Our Consulting Lineage help us to attract and retain high performing workforce that works as effective extension to our clients team.Position: Delivery Lead/ Delivery Manager, Tech StaffingJob Description: We are looking for experienced delivery professionals from Tech Staffing industry. The person must have proven credentials for working on staffing (Sub-con) demands for IT Clients. Individuals with permanent recruitment experience are not the right candidates for this position. This is a mid-level position in the company and will be the key to the success of the business. You will own end to end value chain of the Business; right from managing client POCs, generating new demand and fulfilment of those demands.Responsibilities:1. Delivering on Staffing (Sub-con) mandates for Tier-1 IT Companies and Captive Centres.2. Graduation or more with 7-12 years of industry experience. Formal education of any kind, in IT field, will be an added advantage.2. column2: A logistic coordinator plays a crucial role in managing and coordinating the logistics operations of a company or organization    They are responsible for ensuring the smooth flow of goods, services, or information from the point of origin to the final destination    The specific job duties and responsibilities may vary depending on the industry and organization, but here are some common tasks associated with the role of a logistic coordinator:Planning and Scheduling: Logistic coordinators are responsible for planning and scheduling the transportation of goods or services    This includes determining the most efficient routes, modes of transportation, and delivery schedules to meet customer requirements and minimize costs    Coordination: They coordinate with various stakeholders, such as suppliers, vendors, shipping companies, and internal departments, to ensure timely delivery of goods    This involves monitoring shipments, tracking inventory levels, and resolving any issues or delays that may arise during transportation    Documentation: Logistic coordinators prepare and maintain documentation related to logistics activities    They ensure that all necessary permits, licenses, customs documentation, and shipping records are accurately completed and maintained in compliance with applicable regulations    Inventory Management: They monitor inventory levels, conduct regular stock checks, and coordinate with warehouse personnel to ensure adequate stock availability    Logistic coordinators also analyze inventory data and make recommendations for optimizing inventory levels and minimizing storage costs    Cost Optimization: They work to optimize logistics costs by analyzing transportation rates, negotiating contracts with suppliers and carriers, and identifying cost-saving opportunities    Logistic coordinators may also be involved in budgeting and financial analysis related to logistics operations
column11: Any Graduate, Any Postgraduate
column13: Logistic Coordinator, Financial analysis, Inventory management, Scheduling, Logistics operations, Budgeting, Cost optimization, Monitoring, Inventory, Logistics

We are currently seeking a dedicated and experienced Freight Broker Agent with a strong track record of shipper onboarding in the US and Canadian markets. If you have a passion for the logistics industry and thrive on building strong client relationships, we want you to join our team.   As a Freight Broker Agent, you will play a critical role in expanding our network of shippers in the US and Canadian markets. Your primary responsibility will be to onboard new shippers, establish lasting relationships, and match their transportation needs with our pool of reliable carriers. This position requires a candidate with a minimum of 3 years of shipper onboarding experience and a deep understanding of the transportation and logistics.  Role & responsibilities      Shipper Onboarding:   Identify, contact, and onboard new shippers in the US and Canadian markets to expand our client base.         Client Relationship Management:   Build and maintain strong relationships with shippers, providing exceptional customer service and addressing their transportation needs effectively.         Market Research:   Continuously monitor market trends and shipping demands in the assigned region to identify potential clients and opportunities for growth.         Carrier Matching:   Collaborate with carrier partners to ensure the successful and timely delivery of shipments, meeting shipper requirements.        Rate Negotiation:   Negotiate competitive rates with both shippers and carriers while ensuring profitability and service quality.         Contract Management:   Prepare and manage contracts and agreements with shippers, carriers, and other stakeholders.         Compliance:   Ensure compliance with all industry regulations, including safety and legal requirements. Reporting: Provide regular reports and updates on shipper onboarding activities, achievements, and market insights to the management         Qualifications:   Minimum of 3 years of shipper onboarding experience in the US and Canadian transportation and logistics market. Proven track record of successfully onboarding and managing shipper accounts. Strong understanding of transportation and logistics industry practices and trends.Excellent communication and negotiation skills, with the ability to build and maintain client relationships.
column11: Any Graduate, Any Postgraduate
column13: Client relationship management, Compliance, Contract management, Market research, Customer service, Medical insurance, Freight forwarding, Service quality, Freight, Logistics

column2: Strives to return a satisfactory profit on capital invested in parts inventory. Accomplishes objectives using proper procurement procedures, inventory control, staff utilization, security, pricing, merchandising and data management/invoicing.    Automotive Parts Manager - Essential Duties     Forecasts goals and objectives for the department and strives to meet them.     Hires, trains, motivates, counsels and monitors the performance of all parts department staff.     Prepares and administers an annual operating budget for the parts department.     Maintains a balanced inventory consistent with the requirements of the service department, body shop and other usage.     Establishes pricing parameters in each customer category that generate enough gross profit to produce a satisfactory profit while maintaining customer loyalty.     Establishes individual parts inventory levels and balances them for maximum turnover.     Ensures that parts inventory turns 7-9 times per year.     Monitors and adjusts inventory to minimize obsolescence.     Ensures that all parts are properly tagged so that the dealership recovers full credit from the factory.     Supervises stock order procedures.     Sets and enforces a policy on the special ordering of parts. Ensures that stock orders represent at least (established %) percent of all orders.     Analyse sales, expenses and inventory monthly to maintain profit goals.     Works with the service manager and body shop manager to ensure a timely turnaround of parts needed for internal jobs.     Analyse departmental operations and storage layout and revises as needed for maximum effectiveness.     Provides technical assistance to parts department employees.     Monitors parts department employees payroll records.     Coordinates a prompt, efficient and timely flow of information.     Directs shipping and receiving efforts to ensure timely processing..     Ensures that all purchases are properly accounted for before payment is made.     Assists in the collection of past-due accounts.     Supervises custodians to ensure that work area is kept clean.     Maintains professional appearance.     Other duties as assigned.

column2: A Technical Superintendent is a key role in the maritime industry, specifically within the shipping or maritime operations sector    They are responsible for overseeing the technical aspects of vessel operations and ensuring that ships are maintained and operated in compliance with industry regulations and standards    Here are the primary responsibilities of a Technical Superintendent:Vessel Maintenance and Repairs: Technical Superintendents are responsible for coordinating and supervising the maintenance, repair, and dry-docking activities of vessels under their management    They develop maintenance plans, monitor the condition of machinery and equipment, and schedule necessary repairs to ensure the safe and efficient operation of the vessels    Compliance with Regulations: They ensure that vessels comply with various international and national regulations, classification society requirements, and industry standards    They keep abreast of regulatory changes, implement necessary modifications or upgrades, and oversee inspections and audits to maintain compliance    Budgeting and Cost Control: Technical Superintendents manage the budget for vessel maintenance and repair activities    They prepare cost estimates, analyze expenses, and control costs to ensure efficient allocation of resources    They may also liaise with suppliers and negotiate contracts to obtain competitive pricing for services and spare parts    Spare Parts and Inventory Management: They oversee the procurement, storage, and management of spare parts, consumables, and supplies required for vessel operations    They maintain inventory levels, coordinate with suppliers, and ensure timely availability of necessary items to minimize downtime    Crew Training and Development: Technical Superintendents provide guidance and support to vessel crews regarding technical operations, maintenance procedures, and safety protocols    They may organize training programs or workshops to enhance the skills and knowledge of the onboard technical staff    Safety and Environmental Compliance: They enforce safety procedures and ensure that vessels comply with environmental regulations, including pollution prevention measures    They monitor the implementation of safety management systems and conduct risk assessments to mitigate potential hazards    Performance Monitoring: Technical Superintendents analyze vessel performance data, such as fuel consumption, machinery efficiency, and voyage analysis    They identify areas for improvement and implement measures to optimize vessel performance, reduce fuel consumption, and enhance operational efficiency    Emergency Response and Crisis Management: They contribute to emergency response planning and crisis management procedures    They work closely with vessel crews, onboard officers, and shore-based teams to develop contingency plans, conduct drills, and respond effectively to emergency situations    Technical Documentation and Reporting: They maintain accurate records and documentation related to vessel operations, maintenance activities, inspections, and repairs    They prepare technical reports, including condition assessment reports, repair status reports, and maintenance history reports for internal and external stakeholders    Technical Support and Troubleshooting: Technical Superintendents provide technical support and guidance to onboard personnel and shore-based teams    They assist in troubleshooting technical issues, identify root causes of problems, and recommend appropriate solutions or repairs
column11: Any Graduate, Any Postgraduate
column13: Procurement, Technical Superintendent, Crisis management, Spare parts, Maritime, Troubleshooting, Operations, Technical support, Technical documentation

column2: About Position: - Position: "Trade & Custom Analyst" Experience: 1- 3 yrs. Location: Bangalore Job Description ??Responsible for classifying commodities, software, and technology with Harmonized Tariff System Numbers (HTS) for US, EU and AP Countries. ??Responsible for classifying commodities, software, and technology with Export Control Classification Numbers (ECCN's) according to the Bureau of Industry and Security's Commerce Control List (CCL) and other EU and AP country laws and regulations. ??Interface with relevant vendor engineering design / Product Management/ Sales/ Procurement team to determine and validate product classification. ??Respond and maintain classification data in the SAP- GTS, and complete classifications assigned within the defined turnaround time. ??Ensure data integrity related to classification and value information declared to Customs authorities. ??Responsible for ensuring legal compliance within government rules and regulations pertaining to classification ??Ability to research discrepancies and provide substantiation to support classification claims to Customs In a timely manner. ??Establish and maintain a central database of global Harmonized Tariff Schedules (HTS) , Export Control Classification Numbers (ECCN) and duty/ tax rates for all products. ??Support implementation of approved internal trade projects related to classification and other import and export area. ??Submit binding rulings when necessary and applicable ??Support denied party screening, Country of Origin and Free Trade Agreement related projects. Eligibility Criteria: ??1 Years Experience in trade and customs areas specific to HTS/ ECCN classification. ??Degree in business, finance or related engineering field. Engineering Graduates or Graduates with customs background preferred ??Familiarity with Export Administration Regulations and those of U.S. Customs and Border Protection as well as the Customs regulations for the AP, US, EU Region will be an added advantage ??Knowledgeable with MS Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.}, and SAP Personal Trait Profile: ??Self- starter minimal supervision required ??Strong analytical and problem solving skills ??Excellent oral and written communication skills .Cross- cultural communication skill desired ??Excellent organizational skills with attention to detail ??Must be able to work with R&, procurement, Product Management & Logistics group Additional Information Interested candidates can send your updated profile with below mentioned details. Total Experience Relevant experience Current CTC Expected CTC Notice Period Reason for job change With Regards, Rashmi Sr. HR Recruiter AARNA HR SOLUTIONS 9108013349

column2: Job DescriptionPOSITION VACANT: Vaccine Logistics & Cold Chain Managers (VCCM), 159, Vacancies in each District of Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh and RajasthanBACKGROUND: Strategic Alliance Management Services P Ltd. (SAMS) is apremier management consultancy that has focused exclusively for the past 18 years, on providing recruitment, payrolling and supply chain management services, exclusively to the public health and development sectors in India.SAMS? clients include bilaterals, multilaterals, I/ NGOs and both Central and State Government organizations. SAMS has managed drug logistics and health supplies for the Revised National Tuberculosis Control Programme (RNTCP) at CTD, MoHFW for the past 15 years. SAMS has provided similar support to NVBDCP and briefly to NACP.Ernst & Young (EY) has awarded SAMS a large supply-chain, capacity building project, to help state health officers adopt innovative changes to cold chain logistics of vaccines, in the states of Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan. This is under the Electronic Vaccine Intelligence Network (eVIN) project, an exciting, ?breakthrough? initiative that is expected to improve the availability of quality vaccines to the Universal Immunization Programme (UIP), at the state and district levels.The project is funded through December 2016.JOB DESCRIPTION/ RESPONSIBILITIES:Reporting to the District Immunization Officer (DIO)/ RCHO, Supply Chain IT Officer (SCO-IT) and UNDP Project Officer (Division/ Cluster level), the VCCMs shall be responsible for managing programme planning, implementation, capacity building, monitoring and reporting, for all cold chain projects.Key Job Responsibilities:(A) Programme Planning and Implementation:(1) Planning and execution of all activities related to eVIN implementation in the designated district, in close coordination with district DIO/ RCHO;(2) Support the work of Cold Chain Handlers (CCH) at District Vaccine Store (DVS) and cold chain points in improving timely stock entries and their online visibility, including temperature performance of cold chain equipment.(B) Capacity Building and Technical Assistance for Government(1) Developing a detailed workplan for the implementation of eVIN software in the DVS and all cold chain points in consultation with DIO/ RCHO;(2) Supporting DIO/ RCHOs in generating reports relating to stock levels, re-order levels, distribution plans, stock forecasting for vaccines and supplies and online stock monitoring to reduce excess stock/ avoid stock-outs;(3) Supporting DIO/ RCHO in planning for preventive maintenance of cold chain equipment;(4) Supporting DIO/ RCHO in the development of distribution cycles and optimum routes for vaccines/ supplies, for use by the DVS in-Charge;(5) Ensuring site readiness at various cold chain points for the installation of Temp Loggers;(6) Ensuring that all transactions (issues, receipts, discards, transfers etc.) of vaccines and syringes are entered in the eVIN system at the district level, as well as at cold chain points;(7) Reviewing online stock data for all vaccines/ supplies and temp logger data, on a daily basis and informing DIO/ RCHO/ DVS in-Charge to initiate desired action;(8) Ensuring regular & timely updation from all cold chain points, after collection/ distribution/ returns from the field (within 24 hours). During visit to CCH, ensure hands-on training on all aspects for which CCHs require support;(9) Reporting dysfunctional eVIN software/ mobile/ Temp Loggers to Supply Chain Officer-IT (SCO-IT) for resolution, if not possible locally. Reporting if prescribed reporting formats/ stock registers/ Temp logbooks, are in use at all levels visited;(10) Regular analysis of consumption patterns and wastage rates for vaccines and supplies for developing monthly reports to support DIO in taking corrective action;(11) Monitoring cold chain performance through remote temperature loggers and ensuring prompt follow-up of response by the concerned person, to temperature excursion alerts, at cold chain points across the district;(12) Validating stock transactions and temperature records in all/ not less than 10 Cold Chain Points every month, where CCH has been provided with mobile, eVIN software and training. [Stock transactions (all antigens, dropper, diluent and syringes) include stock registers, issue/ receipt vouchers, vaccine distribution registers, eVIN mobile phone entries and online (web) entries. Temperature records include temperature logbook entries for twice daily temperature records, alerts and breaches and their corresponding records on eVIN software/ alerts];(13) Verifying data integrity/ accuracy of system developed reports from eVIN software from mobile/ web based solutions/ Temp Logger, for all locations validated;(14) Coordinating with State Capacity Building Lead (SCBL) to nominate new staff or refresher training participants based on identified training needs;(15) Participating in review meetings for CCHs and providing status report/ feedback;(16) Working closely with state and district level health officials and UNDP state project officers. Coordinating with GAVI-HSS partners (namely UNICEF and WHO) and other development partners working on immunization, as necessary;(17) Any other task assigned by the SCO-IT, as and when required, to support eVIN implementation.(C) Monitoring and Evaluation(1) Undertaking field visits to monitor the implementation of the system and provide technical inputs to address gaps and bottlenecks in the implementation of eVIN;(2) Undertaking field visits for 15 days in a month within the district.(D) Report Writing(1) Preparing periodic status reports, annual reports, case studies etc. in a qualitative and timely manner.QualificationsQUALIFICATIONS, EXPERIENCE AND COMPETENCIES:Qualification:Applicants must possess at least a Graduation Degree, with additional qualification in Business Administration/ Public Health/ Hospital Management/ Social Science/ Material Management or Supply Chain Management, from a reputed University/ Institution.Experience:(1) A minimum of 2-3 years of professional work experience at the State/ District level in IT or supply chain related projects;(2) Preference will be given to candidates with experience in public health/ health care/ vaccine management or cold chain management;(3) Experience in immunization programmes will be an advantage;(4) Experience of working in the State Government or international development organization will be an asset.Skills & Abilities:(1) Should have a valid driving license and be comfortable driving a two wheeler vehicle;(2) Must be proficient in computers. Knowledge of MS-Office applications viz. Excel; Word and PowerPoint and internet is essential;(3) Excellent knowledge of written and spoken English is essential. Good working knowledge of the local language of the duty station, will be an asset;(4) Strong analytical, negotiating and communication skills;(5) Sound knowledge of the health system of the country and states.Please note that VCCMs shall be on the payroll of SAMS.*Please note that the above mentioned vacancies shall be filled in a phased manner over a period of six months. LAST DATE FOR APPLICATIONS:Eligible candidates interested in this position are requested to apply online at http:/ / sams.co.in/ samsrecruitment/ VCCMform.php giving details of three references and current compensation drawn, by or before August, 10, 2015. For further details please visit www.sams.co.inApplicants are urged to apply immediately, as interviews with the promising candidates will start almost right away.QUALIFICATIONS,  EXPERIENCE AND COMPETENCIES:  Qualification:  Applicants must possess at least a Graduation Degree,  with additional qualification in Business Administration/  Public Health/  Hospital Management/  Social Science/  Material Management or Supply Chain Management,  from a reputed University/  Institution. Experience:  (1) A minimum of 2- 3 years of professional work experience at the State/  District level in IT or supply chain related projects;(2) Preference will be given to candidates with experience in public health/  health care/  vaccine management or cold chain management;(3) Experience in immunization programmes will be an advantage; (4) Experience of working in the State Government or international development organization will be an asset. Skills & Abilities:  (1) Should have a valid driving license and be comfortable driving a two wheeler vehicle;(2) Must be proficient in computers. Knowledge of MS- Office applications viz. column2: As Senior Product Manager for the Supply Chain Design Planning team, you ll evolve, define and build innovative, differentiating and profitable products by leveraging your industry experience and engagement with forward thinking customers   You must possess a unique blend of business, technical savvy and supply chain domain expertise bundled with a drive to make your vision a reality   You must enjoy spending time with customers to understand their pain points and find innovative solutions for the broader market   You relentlessly seek solutions that have a measurable commercial impact and can elaborate these financial benefits in the solution   You will be responsible for applications across the entire product lifecycle from strategy to delivery with all the steps in between like defining market needs, writing detailed product requirements, providing development support, communicating the solution s benefits and enabling downstream teams      What you ll do:     Own the end-to-end product lifecycle, from strategic planning, roadmapping and development of innovative features and enhancements, ensuring alignment with overall product goals   Conduct comprehensive market research to identify and prioritize opportunities for product differentiation and growth, based on market trends, customer feedback and business objectives   Define detailed feature requirements, create user stories and oversee successful execution of product roadmap in partnership with Engineering, UX, as well as customers   Work closely with the engineering team throughout the design, build, signoff on quality acceptance criteriaand documentation processes.   Partner with sales marketing to help with product positioning, webinars and field enablement initiatives   Measure success of your product, drive business growth, feature adoption, and reduction in time-to-value, through continuous improvement of features, and cross-functional customer enablement        What You Bring To Coupa:     You have 5+ years of Product Management experience, with a focus on enterprise SaaS.   You have a good understanding of functional and technical needs for supply chain applications   You can convert complex and ambiguous customer problems into concrete, delightful product features   You have a keen eye for design and user experience   You are analytical, fact-based, and adept at problem-solving.   You are action-oriented and collaborative, consistently striving for clarity and timely delivery   You exhibit willingness to dive into hands-on tasks, demonstrating perseverance in the face of challenges   You preferably hold a BA/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field. An MBA or a background in Supply Chain Design Planning is a strong plus

column2: A Technical Superintendent is a key role in the maritime industry, specifically within the shipping or maritime operations sector   They are responsible for overseeing the technical aspects of vessel operations and ensuring that ships are maintained and operated in compliance with industry regulations and standards     Here are the primary responsibilities of a Technical Superintendent:     Vessel Maintenance and Repairs: Technical Superintendents are responsible for coordinating and supervising the maintenance, repair, and dry-docking activities of vessels under their management   They develop maintenance plans, monitor the condition of machinery and equipment, and schedule necessary repairs to ensure the safe and efficient operation of the vessels   Compliance with Regulations: They ensure that vessels comply with various international and national regulations, classification society requirements, and industry standards   They keep abreast of regulatory changes, implement necessary modifications or upgrades, and oversee inspections and audits to maintain compliance   Budgeting and Cost Control: Technical Superintendents manage the budget for vessel maintenance and repair activities   They prepare cost estimates, analyze expenses, and control costs to ensure efficient allocation of resources   They may also liaise with suppliers and negotiate contracts to obtain competitive pricing for services and spare parts   Spare Parts and Inventory Management: They oversee the procurement, storage, and management of spare parts, consumables, and supplies required for vessel operations   They maintain inventory levels, coordinate with suppliers, and ensure timely availability of necessary items to minimize downtime   Crew Training and Development: Technical Superintendents provide guidance and support to vessel crews regarding technical operations, maintenance procedures, and safety protocols   They may organize training programs or workshops to enhance the skills and knowledge of the onboard technical staff   Safety and Environmental Compliance: They enforce safety procedures and ensure that vessels comply with environmental regulations, including pollution prevention measures   They monitor the implementation of safety management systems and conduct risk assessments to mitigate potential hazards   Performance Monitoring: Technical Superintendents analyze vessel performance data, such as fuel consumption, machinery efficiency, and voyage analysis   They identify areas for improvement and implement measures to optimize vessel performance, reduce fuel consumption, and enhance operational efficiency   Emergency Response and Crisis Management: They contribute to emergency response planning and crisis management procedures   They work closely with vessel crews, onboard officers, and shore-based teams to develop contingency plans, conduct drills, and respond effectively to emergency situations   Technical Documentation and Reporting: They maintain accurate records and documentation related to vessel operations, maintenance activities, inspections, and repairs   They prepare technical reports, including condition assessment reports, repair status reports, and maintenance history reports for internal and external stakeholders   Technical Support and Troubleshooting: Technical Superintendents provide technical support and guidance to onboard personnel and shore-based teams   They assist in troubleshooting technical issues, identify root causes of problems, and recommend appropriate solutions or repairs
column11: Any Graduate, Any Postgraduate
column13: Procurement, Technical Superintendent, Crisis management, Spare parts, Maritime, Troubleshooting, Operations, Technical support, Technical documentation

column2: We are seeking an experienced Perl Developer to join our dynamic team at a leading Healthcare SaaS company    Our entire ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and core business logic are rooted in Perl, making this role crucial for the maintenance and development of our systems    The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Perl programming, with a keen understanding of how to manage and manipulate large data sets in a healthcare environment        Key Responsibilities:     1. Develop and Maintain Perl Applications:      Design, develop, and maintain Perl applications integral to our ETL processes and business logic.     Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.    2. Data Management:      Handle large datasets, implementing processes for data extraction, transformation, and loading.     Work closely with the data team to ensure data integrity and efficiency of data processing.    3. System Optimization:      Continuously identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems.     Optimize the performance of backend systems for speed and efficiency.    4. Collaboration and Communication:      Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.     Effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical staff.    5. Compliance and Best Practices:      Ensure the application adheres to healthcare industry standards and regulatory compliance, particularly in data handling and security.     Maintain code quality, organization, and automation.    6. Technical Support and Documentation:      Provide technical support, including root cause analysis and remediation of production issues.     Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for system software.    Qualifications:      Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.          Strong knowledge and working experience in cloud infrastructure like AWS, Azure, or GCP       Proven software development experience in Perl.       Strong understanding of Perl programming and its nuances.       Strong Knowledge of relational databases and SQL.      Familiarity with front-end technologies (such as JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3) is a plus.     Experience in healthcare IT and understanding of healthcare data standards (such as HL7, FHIR) preferred.     Solid understanding of object-oriented programming.     Familiarity with version control tools like Git.     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Verify and track received inventory and complete inventory reports and logs. Perform any other duties as assigned by the management or supervisors.

column2: As a Product Manager on the Coupa Supply Chain Collaboration team, you ll help us define and build products that are valuable, usable, and feasible    You sit in the middle of the business community, engineering team, and user experience team and are the voice of the customer   You ll build features and develop new and innovative ideas based on your industry experience and your contact with customers and prospects   You must possess a unique blend of business and technical savviness; a big-picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality   You must enjoy spending time with customers to understand their pain points and find innovative solutions for the broader market         What Youll Do:     Operate with a general manager mindset, and manage the entire product life cycle from strategic planning, road mapping, feature design, development support, go-to-market, and field support for the product area that you own   Specify market requirements for current and future products by conducting market research supported by close collaboration with customers and prospects   Work cross-functionally to ensure alignment between other product areas and the wider technical of subjects to kindergartners, and have them ask intelligent questions about it   You can convert complex and ambiguous customer problems into concrete, delightful product features   You column2: Roles and Responsibilities     JOB PURPOSE      To direct the Global Sales & Marketing portfolio, formulation of strategy, business promotion, optimal utilization of resources, and liaison with Line Management.    The position will solicit business from global accounts with the primary goal of gaining more business and ensuring profitability.     KEY RESPONSIBILITIES     Responsible for P&L. Formulate and communicate Sales & Marketing strategies keeping in mind the marketing plan process, the Budgets/Targets approved by the Board and Line Management.   Explore new markets and business opportunities with a view to ensuring that the Group market share is maintained and wherever viable, exceeded. Monitor Sales performance of Branches vis a vis target. Make regular visits to all branches.    Maintain and monitor high level contact with top exporters, importers, freight forwarders, shippers and consignees. Responsible for enforcing the Credit Control policy with a view to ensure that outstanding are kept to the minimum.    Ensure ongoing close liaison with the Operations, Documentation, CFS &Trucking functions to capitalize on capacity and resource allocations to provide a synergistic approach to customers and to address and resolve commercial issues impacting on the business.    Responsible for overall operations of the region right from Job openings, job closing, attending system issues, address all operational issues in terms of job movement, etc.    Ensure maximum Market penetration. Ensure that systems supporting the Sales & Marketing function are used appropriately, and optimal benefits are derived. Ensure that reporting requirements of various Line Management desks are complied with in a timely manner and the data is accurate    Ensure that the organization is fully acquainted with service plans, acceptance policies and other pertinent aspects of our service scope.   Determine sales promotion strategies at a Macro level and communicates them to all regions to ensure maximum mileage is achieved.    Constantly monitor the performance of sub-agencies, handling agencies and ensure their contribution to the Line is proportionate to the investments made in them. Promote new ICDs and regularly monitor ICD performance.    Generate nominations and Import Leads. Apart from the duties and responsibilities listed above, any other additional duties as advised by the management from time to time.     KEY RESULT AREAS     Achieve minimum of 5 times of Gross salary as Gross profit.Ensure collections are done within the credit period.Onboarding new customers   Responsible for overall operations of the region right from Job openings, job closing, attending system issues, address all operational issues in terms of job movement, etc.   Compilation and collection of data for periodic reporting to Senior Management and Principals.Clearing of all the disputed and claim related shipments on time.   Preparation of various reports such as branch wise performance, sector wise performance, salesman wise performance, vessel wise performance etc. Monitor cargo delay from top customers and ensure no delay in the same.   YELLOW LINES 1. Ensure renewal and adherence of Service Contracts 2. Ensure that checks and regulations are followed for booking special equipment like Reefer, Hazardous cargo 3. Ensure rates are and contracts are negotiated with the top customers     Desired Candidate Profile     Educational Qualification(s)     Graduate or post graduate Prior Experience: 10-15 years    Skills & Personal Attributes Knowledge of the Shipping Laws & Trade Practices Good communication, industry knowledge and self -driven approach.

column2: To prepare the seasonal estimates of all stores in advance and to submit proposals for remodeling of existing stores.            To find out new locations and negotiate for our expansion in order to increase business and market share.            To constantly analyze inform H.O. about market trends general economic trends in respective areas how these trends might affect our business.            To submit proposals for temporary outlets to achieve extra business clear stock.            In exceptional cases to co-ordinate with chief buyer to prepare specific shoe line collection for specific store to adapt to the market properly.        Merchandising/Store Management              To ensure that all stores are always supplied with NOOS articles.            To initiate actions to inter-transfer excess stocks on regular basis.            To monitor and clear store wise aged merchandise and ensure no stock older than 12 months in shops.            To ensure that RM80/60 other statements are forwarded according to schedule.            To make arrangements to clear the stock which is not in complete assortment            To coordinate with buyers to ensure that we have adequate stock of all price range with high impact in turnover.            To study and report competitors actions in the district.            To ensure that customer claims are settled logically and properly as per company policy.            To take specific initiatives to sell slow movers in the stores.            To ensure that physical inventory matches with POS report.        Promotion and Display              To ensure that Company Policy directions on displays are followed to maintain the highest standard of continuous aggressive display advertising in each stores.            To ensure the display of New Arrivals and chosen for you Articles in the prime area in every store.            To ensure that seasonal guidelines are being implemented in the respective stores.        Administration and Finance              To ensure that store operation expenses are as per Company Policy and Circulars issued from time to time.            To monitor regularly and arrange settlement of Bulk sale receivable (1042 A/C), Suspense Account (1046), Money-On-Way (1016) Accounts and Goods-On-Way (1302) Account on fortnightly basis. All items in these accounts to be settled within 3 weeks from the date of origin.            To take physical inventories of every store, agency at least once a season and to initiate appropriate action promptly in case of shortage as per Company Policy.            To ensure deposit of sale proceeds in the bank next day. Must pending/ delayed ensure no remittance from any of the store of the District.            To check and ensure that any Price changes as per circulars of the Company are properly implemented.            To prepare a fortnightly traveling and working plan and to submit for approval of Retail Manager.            To ensure that terms and conditions of the tenancy/lease agreement with the landlords of the stores are strictly adhered to and appropriate measures are taken to renew/extend the agreements.            To ensure that company assets are maintained in good condition. All new furniture received by the store is included in the furniture statement of the store. Complete and updated furniture statement must be available at the store.            In case of any loss due to theft, fire or burglary, necessary requirements for Insurance claims are complied with.            To ensure full implementation of Company s instructions as specified in circulars are applied within the specified deadlines in the district.            To ensure full compliance of the Chart of Authority of the Company issued from time to time.            To initiate disciplinary action against recalcitrant store employees and against manager with inventory shortage above company standard in accordance with the set Rules of the Company.        Personnel              To ensure that all stores are within the approved number of personnel.            To ensure that the store personnel are presentable, properly trained, well groomed and provide best service to customers.            To ensure that managers and store personnel are familiar with Company s objectives and goals and work towards their achievements.            To develop lines of communications which will ensure a continuous flow of information with subordinates as well as management            To ensure that Store Manager is allocating objectives to all personnel on daily/weekly basis and ensure that morning meetings are conducted in the stores.            To participate in selection of shop employees and managers for promotion to higher type shops as and when required.            To train store personnel on Bata 5 Steps of Customer Service to render best services to our customers.        Business Plan achievement              Prepare, implement and achieve operational business plan and estimates for the efficient operation of your region.            Work closely with the product development manager and the merchandise manager in the development creation and timely establishment of a shoe line.            Suggest price policy, have up to date calculations on the shoe categories and monitor the profitability (EBIT) of stores.        Budgeting, Control and Spending              To arrange for necessary budget outlays available for business spending requirements.            To initiate measures for optimization of resources to control on expenses in all business areas with a particular focus on personnel cost and productivity.            Control expenses and see that expenditures are within approved limits, check weekly profit and loss account and take corrective actions.        Business Performance Monitoring              To review and monitor performance of all stores in the region on ongoing basis to exercise control, issue necessary direction, uninterrupted support and corrective actions so as to enhance the efficiency of entire regional business value chain.            To ensure that there is an achievement of the required business growth over the previous year.            To ensure the following is achieved - Estimated margin, Maximum six weeks sale in stocks available across chain, 60% of lines with complete assortment, stock not more than 12 months.        Merchandise Management              Overall responsibility of maintaining stock standard at or within the approved level, while at the same time ensuring proper supply at the stores.            Control over quality and age of merchandise and take action in regard to liquidation of seasonal merchandise or slow moving articles.        Market Intelligence and Strategy implementation              Visit competitors store and keep a tab on events occurring in market place so as to devise an appropriate strategy to excel in competition.            Visit the stores regularly for the purpose of planning market strategy, reviewing the status of stock and supply, discussing with shop managers and shop employees and finally the product.
